    13‚Üífrom pathlib import Path
    14‚Üífrom datetime import datetime
    15‚Üífrom typing import Dict, List, Any, Optional, Tuple
    16‚Üíimport click
    17‚Üíimport threading
    18‚Üíimport queue
    19‚Üíimport logging
    20‚Üí
    21‚Üíclass MCPClaudePipelineOrchestrator:
    22‚Üí    """Master orchestrator that coordinates all linters, quality patcher, and publishing pipeline"""
    23‚Üí    
    24‚Üí    def __init__(self, repo_path: Path = None):
    25‚Üí        self.repo_path = repo_path or Path.cwd()
    26‚Üí        self.pipeline_id = datetime.now().strftime("%Y%m%d_%H%M%S")
    27‚Üí        self.state_file = self.repo_path / ".mcp-pipeline-state.json"
    28‚Üí        
    29‚Üí        # Component paths with validation
    30‚Üí        self.components = {
    31‚Üí            "version_keeper": self.repo_path / "scripts" / "version_keeper.py",
    32‚Üí            "quality_patcher": self.repo_path / "scripts" / "claude_quality_patcher.py", 
    33‚Üí            "integration_loop": self.repo_path / "scripts" / "claude_code_integration_loop.py",
    34‚Üí            "oversight_loop": self.repo_path / "scripts" / "claude_oversight_loop.py"
    35‚Üí        }
    36‚Üí        
    37‚Üí        # Pipeline state and monitoring
    38‚Üí        self.pipeline_state = {
    39‚Üí            "pipeline_id": self.pipeline_id,
    40‚Üí            "start_time": None,
    41‚Üí            "current_phase": "initialization",
    42‚Üí            "phases_completed": [],
    43‚Üí            "phases_failed": [],
    44‚Üí            "component_outputs": {},
    45‚Üí            "issue_counts": [],
    46‚Üí            "monitoring_data": {},
    47‚Üí            "redundancy_checkpoints": [],
    48‚Üí            "claude_work_assignments": []
    49‚Üí        }
    50‚Üí        
    51‚Üí        # Monitoring and redundancy
    52‚Üí        self.monitoring_queue = queue.Queue()
    53‚Üí        self.redundancy_backups = {}
    54‚Üí        self.component_health = {}
    55‚Üí        
    56‚Üí        # Setup logging
    57‚Üí        self.setup_logging()
    58‚Üí        self.validate_components()
    59‚Üí        
    60‚Üí    def setup_logging(self):
    61‚Üí        """Setup comprehensive logging system"""
    62‚Üí        log_dir = self.repo_path / ".mcp-pipeline-logs"
    63‚Üí        log_dir.mkdir(exist_ok=True)
    64‚Üí        
    65‚Üí        self.log_file = log_dir / f"pipeline_{self.pipeline_id}.log"
    66‚Üí        
    67‚Üí        logging.basicConfig(
    68‚Üí            level=logging.INFO,
    69‚Üí            format='%(asctime)s - %(levelname)s - %(message)s',
    70‚Üí            handlers=[
    71‚Üí                logging.FileHandler(self.log_file),
    72‚Üí                logging.StreamHandler(sys.stdout)
    73‚Üí            ]
    74‚Üí        )
    75‚Üí        self.logger = logging.getLogger("MCPPipeline")
    76‚Üí        
    77‚Üí    def validate_components(self):
    78‚Üí        """Validate all required components exist and are executable"""
    79‚Üí        self.logger.info("üîç Validating pipeline components...")
    80‚Üí        
    81‚Üí        missing_components = []
    82‚Üí        for name, path in self.components.items():
    83‚Üí            if not path.exists():
    84‚Üí                missing_components.append(f"{name}: {path}")
    85‚Üí            else:
    86‚Üí                self.component_health[name] = "healthy"
    87‚Üí                
    88‚Üí        if missing_components:
    89‚Üí            self.logger.error(f"‚ùå Missing components: {missing_components}")
    90‚Üí            raise FileNotFoundError(f"Required components missing: {missing_components}")
    91‚Üí            
    92‚Üí        self.logger.info("‚úÖ All pipeline components validated")
    93‚Üí        
    94‚Üí    def save_pipeline_state(self):
    95‚Üí        """Save current pipeline state with redundancy"""
    96‚Üí        try:
    97‚Üí            # Primary state file
    98‚Üí            with open(self.state_file, 'w') as f:
    99‚Üí                json.dump(self.pipeline_state, f, indent=2, default=str)
   100‚Üí                
   101‚Üí            # Redundancy backup
   102‚Üí            backup_file = self.state_file.with_suffix(f".backup_{int(time.time())}.json")
   103‚Üí            with open(backup_file, 'w') as f:
   104‚Üí                json.dump(self.pipeline_state, f, indent=2, default=str)
   105‚Üí                
   106‚Üí            self.redundancy_backups[backup_file.name] = backup_file
   107‚Üí            
   108‚Üí            # Keep only last 5 backups
   109‚Üí            if len(self.redundancy_backups) > 5:
   110‚Üí                oldest = min(self.redundancy_backups.keys())
   111‚Üí                oldest_file = self.redundancy_backups.pop(oldest)
   112‚Üí                oldest_file.unlink(missing_ok=True)
   113‚Üí                
   114‚Üí        except Exception as e:
   115‚Üí            self.logger.error(f"Failed to save pipeline state: {e}")
   116‚Üí            
   117‚Üí    def load_pipeline_state(self) -> bool:
   118‚Üí        """Load existing pipeline state for resumption"""
   119‚Üí        if self.state_file.exists():
   120‚Üí            try:
   121‚Üí                with open(self.state_file, 'r') as f:
   122‚Üí                    loaded_state = json.load(f)
   123‚Üí                    self.pipeline_state.update(loaded_state)
   124‚Üí                    self.logger.info(f"üìÇ Loaded existing pipeline state: {loaded_state.get('pipeline_id')}")
   125‚Üí                    return True
   126‚Üí            except Exception as e:
   127‚Üí                self.logger.warning(f"Could not load pipeline state: {e}")
   128‚Üí        return False
   129‚Üí        
   130‚Üí    def start_monitoring_thread(self):
   131‚Üí        """Start background monitoring thread"""
   132‚Üí        def monitor():
   133‚Üí            while True:
   134‚Üí                try:
   135‚Üí                    # Check component health
   136‚Üí                    for name, path in self.components.items():
   137‚Üí                        if path.exists():
   138‚Üí                            self.component_health[name] = "healthy"
   139‚Üí                        else:
   140‚Üí                            self.component_health[name] = "missing"
   141‚Üí                            
   142‚Üí                    # Update monitoring data
   143‚Üí                    self.pipeline_state["monitoring_data"] = {
   144‚Üí                        "timestamp": datetime.now().isoformat(),
   145‚Üí                        "component_health": self.component_health.copy(),
   146‚Üí                        "memory_usage": self.get_memory_usage(),
   147‚Üí                        "disk_usage": self.get_disk_usage()
   148‚Üí                    }
   149‚Üí                    
   150‚Üí                    time.sleep(30)  # Monitor every 30 seconds
   151‚Üí                    
   152‚Üí                except Exception as e:
   153‚Üí                    self.logger.error(f"Monitoring error: {e}")
   154‚Üí                    time.sleep(60)
   155‚Üí                    
   156‚Üí        monitor_thread = threading.Thread(target=monitor, daemon=True)
   157‚Üí        monitor_thread.start()
   158‚Üí        self.logger.info("üîç Background monitoring started")
   159‚Üí        
   160‚Üí    def get_memory_usage(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
   161‚Üí        """Get system memory usage"""
   162‚Üí        try:
   163‚Üí            result = subprocess.run(['ps', 'aux'], capture_output=True, text=True)
   164‚Üí            python_processes = [line for line in result.stdout.split('\n') if 'python' in line.lower()]
   165‚Üí            return {"python_processes": len(python_processes)}
   166‚Üí        except:
   167‚Üí            return {"error": "could_not_determine"}
   168‚Üí            
   169‚Üí    def get_disk_usage(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
   170‚Üí        """Get disk usage for repo directory"""
   171‚Üí        try:
   172‚Üí            result = subprocess.run(['du', '-sh', str(self.repo_path)], capture_output=True, text=True)
   173‚Üí            return {"repo_size": result.stdout.strip().split()[0] if result.returncode == 0 else "unknown"}
   174‚Üí        except:
   175‚Üí            return {"error": "could_not_determine"}
   176‚Üí            
   177‚Üí    def execute_component_with_monitoring(self, component_name: str, command: List[str], 
   178‚Üí                                        phase_name: str, timeout: int = 3600) -> Dict[str, Any]:
   179‚Üí        """Execute a component with comprehensive monitoring and error handling"""
   180‚Üí        self.logger.info(f"üîß Executing {component_name} for phase: {phase_name}")
   181‚Üí        
   182‚Üí        start_time = datetime.now()
   183‚Üí        checkpoint_id = f"{phase_name}_{component_name}_{int(time.time())}"
   184‚Üí        
   185‚Üí        # Create redundancy checkpoint
   186‚Üí        self.create_redundancy_checkpoint(checkpoint_id, {
   187‚Üí            "component": component_name,
   188‚Üí            "phase": phase_name,
   189‚Üí            "command": command,
   190‚Üí            "start_time": start_time.isoformat()
   191‚Üí        })
   192‚Üí        
   193‚Üí        try:
   194‚Üí            # Execute component
   195‚Üí            result = subprocess.run(
   196‚Üí                command,
   197‚Üí                cwd=self.repo_path,
   198‚Üí                capture_output=True,
   199‚Üí                text=True,
   200‚Üí                timeout=timeout
   201‚Üí            )
   202‚Üí            
   203‚Üí            end_time = datetime.now()
   204‚Üí            duration = (end_time - start_time).total_seconds()
   205‚Üí            
   206‚Üí            # Process and store output
   207‚Üí            execution_result = {
   208‚Üí                "component": component_name,
   209‚Üí                "phase": phase_name,
   210‚Üí                "success": result.returncode == 0,
   211‚Üí                "return_code": result.returncode,
   212‚Üí                "duration_seconds": duration,
   213‚Üí                "start_time": start_time.isoformat(),
   214‚Üí                "end_time": end_time.isoformat(),
   215‚Üí                "stdout": result.stdout,
   216‚Üí                "stderr": result.stderr,
   217‚Üí                "checkpoint_id": checkpoint_id
   218‚Üí            }
   219‚Üí            
   220‚Üí            # Store component output for inter-component communication
   221‚Üí            self.pipeline_state["component_outputs"][component_name] = execution_result
   222‚Üí            
   223‚Üí            # Extract key metrics for pipeline awareness
   224‚Üí            metrics = self.extract_component_metrics(component_name, result.stdout, result.stderr)
   225‚Üí            execution_result["metrics"] = metrics
   226‚Üí            
   227‚Üí            if result.returncode == 0:
   228‚Üí                self.logger.info(f"‚úÖ {component_name} completed successfully in {duration:.1f}s")
   229‚Üí                self.pipeline_state["phases_completed"].append(phase_name)
   230‚Üí            else:
   231‚Üí                self.logger.error(f"‚ùå {component_name} failed with code {result.returncode}")
   232‚Üí                self.pipeline_state["phases_failed"].append(phase_name)
   233‚Üí                
   234‚Üí            return execution_result
   235‚Üí            
   236‚Üí        except subprocess.TimeoutExpired:
   237‚Üí            self.logger.error(f"‚è∞ {component_name} timed out after {timeout} seconds")
   238‚Üí            return {
   239‚Üí                "component": component_name,
   240‚Üí                "phase": phase_name,
   241‚Üí                "success": False,
   242‚Üí                "error": "timeout",
   243‚Üí                "timeout_seconds": timeout,
   244‚Üí                "checkpoint_id": checkpoint_id
   245‚Üí            }
   246‚Üí            
   247‚Üí        except Exception as e:
   248‚Üí            self.logger.error(f"üí• {component_name} execution error: {e}")
   249‚Üí            return {
   250‚Üí                "component": component_name,
   251‚Üí                "phase": phase_name,
   252‚Üí                "success": False,
   253‚Üí                "error": str(e),
   254‚Üí                "checkpoint_id": checkpoint_id
   255‚Üí            }
   256‚Üí            
   257‚Üí        finally:
   258‚Üí            self.save_pipeline_state()
   259‚Üí            
   260‚Üí    def extract_component_metrics(self, component_name: str, stdout: str, stderr: str) -> Dict[str, Any]:
   261‚Üí        """Extract key metrics from component output for pipeline coordination"""
   262‚Üí        import re  # Import at the top of the method for all components to use
   263‚Üí        metrics = {}
   264‚Üí        
   265‚Üí        if component_name == "version_keeper":
   266‚Üí            # Extract lint report info
   267‚Üí            if "claude-lint-report" in stdout:
   268‚Üí                matches = re.findall(r'claude-lint-report-(\d+-\d+)\.json', stdout)
   269‚Üí                if matches:
   270‚Üí                    metrics["lint_report_generated"] = f"claude-lint-report-{matches[-1]}.json"
   271‚Üí                    
   272‚Üí            # Extract issue counts
   273‚Üí            if "Total fixes:" in stdout:
   274‚Üí                matches = re.findall(r'Total fixes:\s*(\d+)', stdout)
   275‚Üí                if matches:
   276‚Üí                    metrics["total_issues_found"] = int(matches[0])
   277‚Üí                    
   278‚Üí        elif component_name == "quality_patcher":
   279‚Üí            # Extract fixes applied
   280‚Üí            if "Fixes Applied:" in stdout:
   281‚Üí                matches = re.findall(r'Fixes Applied:\s*(\d+)', stdout)
   282‚Üí                if matches:
   283‚Üí                    metrics["fixes_applied"] = int(matches[0])
   284‚Üí                    
   285‚Üí            # Extract session results
   286‚Üí            if "fixes_processed" in stdout:
   287‚Üí                try:
   288‚Üí                    # Look for JSON session results
   289‚Üí                    json_match = re.search(r'\{[^}]*"fixes_applied"[^}]*\}', stdout)
   290‚Üí                    if json_match:
   291‚Üí                        session_data = json.loads(json_match.group())
   292‚Üí                        metrics.update(session_data)
   293‚Üí                except:
   294‚Üí                    pass
   295‚Üí                    
   296‚Üí        elif component_name == "integration_loop":
   297‚Üí            # Extract cycle information
   298‚Üí            if "CYCLE" in stdout:
   299‚Üí                matches = re.findall(r'CYCLE (\d+)', stdout)
   300‚Üí                if matches:
   301‚Üí                    metrics["cycles_completed"] = len(set(matches))
   302‚Üí                    metrics["final_cycle"] = int(matches[-1])
   303‚Üí                    
   304‚Üí            # Extract pipeline execution results
   305‚Üí            if "development_branch_published" in stdout:
   306‚Üí                metrics["pipeline_executed"] = True
   307‚Üí                if "YES" in stdout:
   308‚Üí                    metrics["development_branch_published"] = True
   309‚Üí                    
   310‚Üí        elif component_name == "oversight_loop":
   311‚Üí            # Extract oversight workflow results
   312‚Üí            if "WORKFLOW COMPLETE" in stdout:
   313‚Üí                metrics["workflow_completed"] = True
   314‚Üí            if "ALL ISSUES RESOLVED" in stdout:
   315‚Üí                metrics["all_issues_resolved"] = True
   316‚Üí            if "development_branch_published" in stdout:
   317‚Üí                metrics["pipeline_executed"] = True
   318‚Üí                if "YES" in stdout:
   319‚Üí                    metrics["development_branch_published"] = True
   320‚Üí                    
   321‚Üí        return metrics
   322‚Üí        
   323‚Üí    def create_redundancy_checkpoint(self, checkpoint_id: str, data: Dict[str, Any]):
   324‚Üí        """Create redundancy checkpoint for recovery"""
   325‚Üí        checkpoint_dir = self.repo_path / ".mcp-pipeline-checkpoints"
   326‚Üí        checkpoint_dir.mkdir(exist_ok=True)
   327‚Üí        
   328‚Üí        checkpoint_file = checkpoint_dir / f"{checkpoint_id}.json"
   329‚Üí        with open(checkpoint_file, 'w') as f:
   330‚Üí            json.dump(data, f, indent=2, default=str)
   331‚Üí            
   332‚Üí        self.pipeline_state["redundancy_checkpoints"].append({
   333‚Üí            "id": checkpoint_id,
   334‚Üí            "file": str(checkpoint_file),
   335‚Üí            "timestamp": datetime.now().isoformat(),
   336‚Üí            "data": data
   337‚Üí        })
   338‚Üí        
   339‚Üí    def check_inter_component_dependencies(self, phase: str) -> bool:
   340‚Üí        """Check if dependencies for this phase are satisfied"""
   341‚Üí        dependencies = {
   342‚Üí            "lint_generation": [],
   343‚Üí            "quality_patching": ["lint_generation"],
   344‚Üí            "integration_loop": ["lint_generation"],
   345‚Üí            "pipeline_publishing": ["integration_loop"]
   346‚Üí        }
   347‚Üí        
   348‚Üí        required_phases = dependencies.get(phase, [])
   349‚Üí        for required_phase in required_phases:
   350‚Üí            if required_phase not in self.pipeline_state["phases_completed"]:
   351‚Üí                self.logger.warning(f"‚ö†Ô∏è Dependency not met: {phase} requires {required_phase}")
   352‚Üí                return False
   353‚Üí                
   354‚Üí        return True
   355‚Üí        
   356‚Üí    def get_latest_lint_report(self) -> Optional[Path]:
   357‚Üí        """Get the latest lint report for component coordination"""
   358‚Üí        reports_dir = self.repo_path / "reports"
   359‚Üí        if not reports_dir.exists():
   360‚Üí            return None
   361‚Üí            
   362‚Üí        lint_reports = list(reports_dir.glob("claude-lint-report-*.json"))
   363‚Üí        if not lint_reports:
   364‚Üí            return None
   365‚Üí            
   366‚Üí        # Return most recent
   367‚Üí        return max(lint_reports, key=lambda p: p.stat().st_mtime)
   368‚Üí        
   369‚Üí    def count_issues_in_latest_report(self) -> int:
   370‚Üí        """Count issues in the latest lint report for pipeline coordination"""
   371‚Üí        latest_report = self.get_latest_lint_report()
   372‚Üí        if not latest_report:
   373‚Üí            return 0
   374‚Üí            
   375‚Üí        try:
   376‚Üí            with open(latest_report, 'r') as f:
   377‚Üí                report_data = json.load(f)
   378‚Üí                
   379‚Üí            # Count priority fixes
   380‚Üí            priority_fixes = report_data.get("priority_fixes", [])
   381‚Üí            return len(priority_fixes)
   382‚Üí            
   383‚Üí        except Exception as e:
   384‚Üí            self.logger.error(f"Error counting issues: {e}")
   385‚Üí            return 0
   386‚Üí            
   387‚Üí    def create_claude_work_assignment(self, task_type: str, context: Dict[str, Any]) -> Dict[str, Any]:
   388‚Üí        """Create structured work assignment for Claude with complete context"""
   389‚Üí        assignment = {
   390‚Üí            "assignment_id": f"{task_type}_{int(time.time())}",
   391‚Üí            "task_type": task_type,
   392‚Üí            "timestamp": datetime.now().isoformat(),
   393‚Üí            "context": context,
   394‚Üí            "pipeline_state": self.pipeline_state.copy(),
   395‚Üí            "component_outputs": self.pipeline_state["component_outputs"].copy(),
   396‚Üí            "latest_metrics": self.extract_latest_metrics(),
   397‚Üí            "instructions": self.generate_claude_instructions(task_type, context)
   398‚Üí        }
   399‚Üí        
   400‚Üí        self.pipeline_state["claude_work_assignments"].append(assignment)
   401‚Üí        return assignment
   402‚Üí        
   403‚Üí    def extract_latest_metrics(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
   404‚Üí        """Extract latest metrics from all components for Claude context"""
   405‚Üí        latest_metrics = {}
   406‚Üí        
   407‚Üí        for component, output in self.pipeline_state["component_outputs"].items():
   408‚Üí            if "metrics" in output:
   409‚Üí                latest_metrics[component] = output["metrics"]
   410‚Üí                
   411‚Üí        # Add current issue count
   412‚Üí        latest_metrics["current_issues"] = self.count_issues_in_latest_report()
   413‚Üí        latest_metrics["latest_lint_report"] = str(self.get_latest_lint_report()) if self.get_latest_lint_report() else None
   414‚Üí        
   415‚Üí        return latest_metrics
   416‚Üí        
   417‚Üí    def generate_claude_instructions(self, task_type: str, context: Dict[str, Any]) -> str:
   418‚Üí        """Generate detailed instructions for Claude based on pipeline state"""
   419‚Üí        instructions = f"""
   420‚Üíü§ñ CLAUDE WORK ASSIGNMENT: {task_type.upper()}
   421‚Üí
   422‚Üíüìä PIPELINE CONTEXT:
   423‚Üí- Pipeline ID: {self.pipeline_state['pipeline_id']}
   424‚Üí- Current Phase: {self.pipeline_state['current_phase']}
   425‚Üí- Phases Completed: {', '.join(self.pipeline_state['phases_completed'])}
   426‚Üí- Issues Remaining: {self.count_issues_in_latest_report()}
   427‚Üí
   428‚ÜíüéØ TASK DETAILS:
   429‚Üí"""
   430‚Üí        
   431‚Üí        if task_type == "quality_patching":
   432‚Üí            instructions += f"""
   433‚ÜíYour role: Work WITH the quality patcher to fix code issues using your Write/Edit tools
   434‚ÜíKey requirements:
   435‚Üí- The quality patcher will show you EACH fix that needs to be applied
   436‚Üí- You MUST use your Write/Edit tools to apply the fixes as instructed
   437‚Üí- Process fixes one-by-one with validation between each
   438‚Üí- Apply advanced differential restoration (no full rollback)
   439‚Üí- Maintain surgical code preservation
   440‚Üí- Continue until all issues are resolved
   441‚Üí
   442‚ÜíIMPORTANT: The quality patcher needs YOU (Claude) to apply the fixes!
   443‚ÜíIt will show you what needs to be fixed, and you apply it using:
   444‚Üí- Edit tool for modifying existing files
   445‚Üí- Write tool for creating new files
   446‚Üí- Read tool to verify changes
   447‚Üí
   448‚ÜíLatest lint report: {context.get('lint_report', 'Not specified')}
   449‚ÜíIssues to fix: {context.get('initial_issues', 'Unknown')}
   450‚Üí
   451‚ÜíThe pipeline will coordinate between you and the patcher automatically.
   452‚Üí"""
   453‚Üí        
   454‚Üí        elif task_type == "oversight_workflow":
   455‚Üí            instructions += f"""
   456‚ÜíYour role: Execute the complete oversight workflow that manages quality patching and publishing
   457‚ÜíKey requirements:
   458‚Üí- The oversight loop coordinates ALL sub-components (quality patcher, integration loop)
   459‚Üí- YOU (Claude) will work WITH the quality patcher when it needs fixes applied
   460‚Üí- The workflow runs in cycles until ALL issues = 0
   461‚Üí- Automatic development branch publishing when complete
   462‚Üí- Complete transparency and step-by-step progress tracking
   463‚Üí
   464‚ÜíIMPORTANT WORKFLOW COORDINATION:
   465‚Üí- Oversight loop manages the overall process
   466‚Üí- Quality patcher will ask YOU to apply specific fixes using Write/Edit tools
   467‚Üí- Integration loop handles continuous processing cycles
   468‚Üí- Pipeline automatically publishes when issues = 0
   469‚Üí
   470‚ÜíThe oversight system will show you exactly what to do at each step.
   471‚Üí"""
   472‚Üí            
   473‚Üí        elif task_type == "integration_loop":
   474‚Üí            instructions += f"""
   475‚ÜíYour role: Execute continuous rerun loop until ALL issues resolved
   476‚ÜíKey requirements:
   477‚Üí- Run until target issues = 0
   478‚Üí- Use differential restoration system
   479‚Üí- Enable pipeline publishing when complete
   480‚Üí- Process in cycles with progress tracking
   481‚Üí
   482‚ÜíCommand to execute:
   483‚Üípython3 scripts/claude_code_integration_loop.py --continuous-rerun --publish-pipeline
   484‚Üí"""
   485‚Üí
   486‚Üí        elif task_type == "pipeline_publishing":
   487‚Üí            instructions += """
   488‚ÜíYour role: Execute development branch publishing pipeline
   489‚ÜíKey requirements:
   490‚Üí- Create/switch to development branch
   491‚Üí- Stage and commit ALL changes with comprehensive message
   492‚Üí- Run final validation tests
   493‚Üí- Version bump and development tagging
   494‚Üí- Push to remote development branch
   495‚Üí- Generate release documentation
   496‚Üí
   497‚ÜíPipeline will execute automatically when ALL issues = 0
   498‚Üí"""
   499‚Üí        
   500‚Üí        instructions += f"""
   501‚Üíüìã COMPONENT AWARENESS:
   502‚ÜíAll components are aware of each other's output through shared state.
   503‚ÜíLatest component metrics: {json.dumps(self.extract_latest_metrics(), indent=2)}
   504‚Üí
   505‚Üí‚ö†Ô∏è MONITORING:
   506‚ÜíAll actions are monitored and logged to: {self.log_file}
   507‚ÜíPipeline state is saved to: {self.state_file}
   508‚Üí"""
   509‚Üí        
   510‚Üí        return instructions
   511‚Üí        
   512‚Üí    def execute_full_pipeline(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
   513‚Üí        """Execute the complete pipeline from linting to publication"""
   514‚Üí        self.logger.info("üöÄ Starting MCP Claude Pipeline - Full Execution")
   515‚Üí        
   516‚Üí        self.pipeline_state["start_time"] = datetime.now().isoformat()
   517‚Üí        self.pipeline_state["current_phase"] = "pipeline_execution"
   518‚Üí        
   519‚Üí        # Start background monitoring
   520‚Üí        self.start_monitoring_thread()
   521‚Üí        
   522‚Üí        try:
   523‚Üí            # PHASE 1: Comprehensive Linting
   524‚Üí            self.logger.info("\nüìä PHASE 1: COMPREHENSIVE LINTING")
   525‚Üí            self.pipeline_state["current_phase"] = "lint_generation"
   526‚Üí            
   527‚Üí            lint_result = self.execute_component_with_monitoring(
   528‚Üí                "version_keeper",
   529‚Üí                ["python3", str(self.components["version_keeper"]), "--claude-lint", "--detect-duplicates", "--check-connections"],
   530‚Üí                "lint_generation",
   531‚Üí                timeout=1800
   532‚Üí            )
   533‚Üí            
   534‚Üí            # Don't fail the pipeline if linting finds issues - that's expected!
   535‚Üí            # The linter returns non-zero exit code when issues are found, which is normal
   536‚Üí            if not lint_result["success"]:
   537‚Üí                self.logger.warning(f"‚ö†Ô∏è Linting phase found issues (expected): {lint_result.get('return_code', 'unknown')}")
   538‚Üí                # Continue to quality patching phase to fix the issues
   539‚Üí                
   540‚Üí            # Check issues found
   541‚Üí            issues_count = self.count_issues_in_latest_report()
   542‚Üí            self.pipeline_state["issue_counts"].append({
   543‚Üí                "phase": "initial_lint",
   544‚Üí                "count": issues_count,
   545‚Üí                "timestamp": datetime.now().isoformat()
   546‚Üí            })
   547‚Üí            
   548‚Üí            self.logger.info(f"üìã Initial lint complete: {issues_count} issues found")
   549‚Üí            
   550‚Üí            # PHASE 2: Quality Patching Loop
   551‚Üí            if issues_count > 0:
   552‚Üí                self.logger.info(f"\nüîß PHASE 2: QUALITY PATCHING - {issues_count} ISSUES")
   553‚Üí                self.pipeline_state["current_phase"] = "quality_patching"
   554‚Üí                
   555‚Üí                # Print direct Claude instructions for quality patcher
   556‚Üí                self.logger.info("\n" + "="*80)
   557‚Üí                self.logger.info("ü§ñ CLAUDE: TIME TO APPLY FIXES!")
   558‚Üí                self.logger.info("="*80)
   559‚Üí                self.logger.info("üìã INSTRUCTIONS FOR CLAUDE:")
   560‚Üí                self.logger.info("1. The quality patcher will show you specific fixes to apply")
   561‚Üí                self.logger.info("2. Use your Write/Edit tools to apply each fix exactly as shown")
   562‚Üí                self.logger.info("3. The patcher will validate your changes")
   563‚Üí                self.logger.info("4. Continue until all fixes are applied")
   564‚Üí                self.logger.info(f"üéØ TOTAL ISSUES TO FIX: {issues_count}")
   565‚Üí                self.logger.info(f"üìä LINT REPORT: {self.get_latest_lint_report()}")
   566‚Üí                self.logger.info("="*80)
   567‚Üí                self.logger.info("üöÄ Starting quality patcher now...")
   568‚Üí                self.logger.info("="*80 + "\n")
   569‚Üí                
   570‚Üí                # Execute quality patcher directly - let Claude apply the fixes
   571‚Üí                quality_result = self.execute_component_with_monitoring(
   572‚Üí                    "quality_patcher",
   573‚Üí                    ["python3", str(self.components["quality_patcher"]), 
   574‚Üí                     "--lint-report", str(self.get_latest_lint_report()),
   575‚Üí                     f"--max-fixes={issues_count}",  # Fix ALL issues
   576‚Üí                     "--claude-agent"],  # Use Claude agent mode
   577‚Üí                    "direct_quality_patching", 
   578‚Üí                    timeout=3600  # 1 hour for quality patching
   579‚Üí                )
   580‚Üí                
   581‚Üí                if not quality_result["success"]:
   582‚Üí                    self.logger.error(f"‚ùå Quality patcher failed: {quality_result}")
   583‚Üí                    # Continue to report the state even if quality patcher fails
   584‚Üí                    self.pipeline_state["current_phase"] = "quality_patching_failed"
   585‚Üí                    
   586‚Üí                # Check final issues
   587‚Üí                final_issues = self.count_issues_in_latest_report()
   588‚Üí                self.pipeline_state["issue_counts"].append({
   589‚Üí                    "phase": "post_processing",
   590‚Üí                    "count": final_issues,
   591‚Üí                    "timestamp": datetime.now().isoformat()
   592‚Üí                })
   593‚Üí                
   594‚Üí                self.logger.info(f"üéØ Processing complete: {final_issues} issues remaining")
   595‚Üí                
   596‚Üí                # Verify pipeline success
   597‚Üí                if final_issues == 0:
   598‚Üí                    self.logger.info("üéâ ALL ISSUES RESOLVED - Pipeline publishing should be complete")
   599‚Üí                    self.pipeline_state["current_phase"] = "completed_successfully"
   600‚Üí                else:
   601‚Üí                    self.logger.warning(f"‚ö†Ô∏è {final_issues} issues still remain")
   602‚Üí                    self.pipeline_state["current_phase"] = "completed_with_remaining_issues"
   603‚Üí            else:
   604‚Üí                self.logger.info("‚úÖ No issues found - proceeding directly to pipeline publishing")
   605‚Üí                self.pipeline_state["current_phase"] = "no_issues_found"
   606‚Üí                
   607‚Üí            # Generate final comprehensive report
   608‚Üí            final_report = self.generate_final_pipeline_report()
   609‚Üí            
   610‚Üí            return {
   611‚Üí                "success": True,
   612‚Üí                "pipeline_id": self.pipeline_id,
   613‚Üí                "final_phase": self.pipeline_state["current_phase"],
   614‚Üí                "initial_issues": self.pipeline_state["issue_counts"][0]["count"] if self.pipeline_state["issue_counts"] else 0,
   615‚Üí                "final_issues": self.pipeline_state["issue_counts"][-1]["count"] if self.pipeline_state["issue_counts"] else 0,
   616‚Üí                "phases_completed": self.pipeline_state["phases_completed"],
   617‚Üí                "component_outputs": self.pipeline_state["component_outputs"],
   618‚Üí                "final_report_path": final_report,
   619‚Üí                "log_file": str(self.log_file),
   620‚Üí                "state_file": str(self.state_file)
   621‚Üí            }
   622‚Üí            
   623‚Üí        except Exception as e:
   624‚Üí            self.logger.error(f"üí• Pipeline execution failed: {e}")
   625‚Üí            self.pipeline_state["current_phase"] = "failed"
   626‚Üí            self.pipeline_state["error"] = str(e)
   627‚Üí            
   628‚Üí            return {
   629‚Üí                "success": False,
   630‚Üí                "error": str(e),
   631‚Üí                "pipeline_id": self.pipeline_id,
   632‚Üí                "phases_completed": self.pipeline_state["phases_completed"],
   633‚Üí                "phases_failed": self.pipeline_state["phases_failed"],
   634‚Üí                "log_file": str(self.log_file),
   635‚Üí                "state_file": str(self.state_file)
   636‚Üí            }
   637‚Üí            
   638‚Üí        finally:
   639‚Üí            self.save_pipeline_state()
   640‚Üí            
   641‚Üí    def generate_final_pipeline_report(self) -> str:
   642‚Üí        """Generate comprehensive final pipeline report"""
   643‚Üí        report_file = self.repo_path / f"mcp-pipeline-report-{self.pipeline_id}.md"
   644‚Üí        
   645‚Üí        start_time = datetime.fromisoformat(self.pipeline_state["start_time"])
   646‚Üí        end_time = datetime.now()
   647‚Üí        total_duration = (end_time - start_time).total_seconds()
   648‚Üí        
   649‚Üí        # Calculate statistics
   650‚Üí        initial_issues = self.pipeline_state["issue_counts"][0]["count"] if self.pipeline_state["issue_counts"] else 0
   651‚Üí        final_issues = self.pipeline_state["issue_counts"][-1]["count"] if self.pipeline_state["issue_counts"] else 0
   652‚Üí        issues_resolved = initial_issues - final_issues
   653‚Üí        
   654‚Üí        report_content = f"""# üöÄ MCP Claude Pipeline Execution Report
   655‚ÜíGenerated: {end_time.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S')}
   656‚ÜíPipeline ID: {self.pipeline_id}
   657‚Üí
   658‚Üí## üèÜ EXECUTION SUMMARY
   659‚Üí
   660‚Üí### Overall Results
   661‚Üí- **Pipeline Success**: {'‚úÖ YES' if self.pipeline_state['current_phase'] in ['completed_successfully', 'no_issues_found'] else '‚ùå NO'}
   662‚Üí- **Total Duration**: {total_duration/60:.1f} minutes
   663‚Üí- **Final Phase**: {self.pipeline_state['current_phase']}
   664‚Üí
   665‚Üí### Issue Processing
   666‚Üí- **Initial Issues**: {initial_issues}
   667‚Üí- **Final Issues**: {final_issues}
   668‚Üí- **Issues Resolved**: {issues_resolved}
   669‚Üí- **Resolution Rate**: {(issues_resolved/max(1, initial_issues)*100):.1f}%
   670‚Üí
   671‚Üí## üìä COMPONENT EXECUTION DETAILS
   672‚Üí
   673‚Üí"""
   674‚Üí
   675‚Üí        # Add component results
   676‚Üí        for component, output in self.pipeline_state["component_outputs"].items():
   677‚Üí            success_icon = "‚úÖ" if output.get("success", False) else "‚ùå"
   678‚Üí            report_content += f"""
   679‚Üí### {success_icon} {component.title()}
   680‚Üí- **Duration**: {output.get('duration_seconds', 0):.1f} seconds
   681‚Üí- **Return Code**: {output.get('return_code', 'unknown')}
   682‚Üí- **Phase**: {output.get('phase', 'unknown')}
   683‚Üí"""
   684‚Üí            if output.get("metrics"):
   685‚Üí                report_content += f"- **Key Metrics**: {json.dumps(output['metrics'], indent=2)}\n"
   686‚Üí                
   687‚Üí        # Add pipeline state information
   688‚Üí        report_content += f"""
   689‚Üí## üîÑ PIPELINE STATE
   690‚Üí
   691‚Üí### Phases Completed
   692‚Üí{chr(10).join('- ' + phase for phase in self.pipeline_state['phases_completed'])}
   693‚Üí
   694‚Üí### Phases Failed  
   695‚Üí{chr(10).join('- ' + phase for phase in self.pipeline_state['phases_failed']) if self.pipeline_state['phases_failed'] else '- None'}
   696‚Üí
   697‚Üí### Claude Work Assignments
   698‚Üí{len(self.pipeline_state['claude_work_assignments'])} work assignments created
   699‚Üí
   700‚Üí### Redundancy Checkpoints
   701‚Üí{len(self.pipeline_state['redundancy_checkpoints'])} checkpoints created
   702‚Üí
   703‚Üí## üìÅ FILES AND LOGS
   704‚Üí
   705‚Üí### Generated Files
   706‚Üí- **Log File**: `{self.log_file}`
   707‚Üí- **State File**: `{self.state_file}`
   708‚Üí- **Latest Lint Report**: `{self.get_latest_lint_report()}`
   709‚Üí
   710‚Üí### Next Steps
   711‚Üí"""
   712‚Üí
   713‚Üí        if self.pipeline_state['current_phase'] == 'completed_successfully':
   714‚Üí            report_content += """
   715‚Üí‚úÖ **PIPELINE COMPLETE - ALL ISSUES RESOLVED**
   716‚Üí
   717‚ÜíYour development branch should now be published with all quality improvements.
   718‚Üí
   719‚ÜíRecommended next steps:
   720‚Üí1. Verify development branch on GitHub
   721‚Üí2. Run integration tests
   722‚Üí3. Create pull request from development to main
   723‚Üí4. Deploy to staging environment
   724‚Üí"""
   725‚Üí        elif final_issues > 0:
   726‚Üí            report_content += f"""
   727‚Üí‚ö†Ô∏è **PIPELINE INCOMPLETE - {final_issues} ISSUES REMAINING**
   728‚Üí
   729‚ÜíNext steps to complete:
   730‚Üí1. Review remaining issues in latest lint report
   731‚Üí2. Manual intervention may be required for complex issues
   732‚Üí3. Re-run pipeline: `python3 mcp-claude-pipeline.py`
   733‚Üí4. Consider adjusting target thresholds if appropriate
   734‚Üí"""
   735‚Üí        else:
   736‚Üí            report_content += """
   737‚Üíüîç **REVIEW REQUIRED**
   738‚Üí
   739‚ÜíCheck the component outputs and logs for detailed status information.
   740‚Üí"""
   741‚Üí
   742‚Üí        # Write report
   743‚Üí        with open(report_file, 'w') as f:
   744‚Üí            f.write(report_content)
   745‚Üí            
   746‚Üí        self.logger.info(f"üìã Final pipeline report generated: {report_file}")
   747‚Üí        return str(report_file)
   748‚Üí
   749‚Üí@click.command()
   750‚Üí@click.option('--resume', is_flag=True, help='Resume from existing pipeline state')
   751‚Üí@click.option('--repo-path', type=click.Path(exists=True), help='Repository path (default: current directory)')
   752‚Üí@click.option('--max-duration', default=7200, help='Maximum pipeline duration in seconds (default: 2 hours)')
   753‚Üídef main(resume, repo_path, max_duration):
   754‚Üí    """
   755‚Üí    MCP Claude Pipeline - Single Entry Point Master Orchestrator
   756‚Üí    
   757‚Üí    Coordinates all linters, quality patcher, and publishing pipeline with:
   758‚Üí    ‚Ä¢ Complete component awareness and output sharing
   759‚Üí    ‚Ä¢ Redundancy and monitoring systems
   760‚Üí    ‚Ä¢ Structured Claude work assignments
   761‚Üí    ‚Ä¢ Automatic recovery and checkpointing
   762‚Üí    ‚Ä¢ End-to-end pipeline execution
   763‚Üí    
   764‚Üí    SINGLE LINE EXECUTION:
   765‚Üí    python3 mcp-claude-pipeline.py
   766‚Üí    """
   767‚Üí    
   768‚Üí    print("üöÄ MCP CLAUDE PIPELINE - MASTER ORCHESTRATOR")
   769‚Üí    print("=" * 80)
   770‚Üí    print("üì¶ Single entry point for complete linting ‚Üí quality patching ‚Üí publishing")
   771‚Üí    print("üîÑ All components aware of each other's output with redundancy monitoring")
   772‚Üí    print("ü§ñ Claude operates as worker with structured assignments and full context")
   773‚Üí    print()
   774‚Üí    
   775‚Üí    try:
   776‚Üí        # Initialize orchestrator
   777‚Üí        repo_path = Path(repo_path) if repo_path else Path.cwd()
   778‚Üí        orchestrator = MCPClaudePipelineOrchestrator(repo_path)
   779‚Üí        
   780‚Üí        # Resume existing pipeline if requested
   781‚Üí        if resume:
   782‚Üí            if orchestrator.load_pipeline_state():
   783‚Üí                print("üìÇ Resuming from existing pipeline state...")
   784‚Üí            else:
   785‚Üí                print("‚ö†Ô∏è No existing state found, starting fresh pipeline...")
   786‚Üí                
   787‚Üí        # Set up timeout handler
   788‚Üí        def timeout_handler(signum, frame):
   789‚Üí            orchestrator.logger.error(f"‚è∞ Pipeline timed out after {max_duration} seconds")
   790‚Üí            raise TimeoutError(f"Pipeline execution exceeded {max_duration} seconds")
   791‚Üí            
   792‚Üí        signal.signal(signal.SIGALRM, timeout_handler)
   793‚Üí        signal.alarm(max_duration)
   794‚Üí        
   795‚Üí        # Execute full pipeline
   796‚Üí        result = orchestrator.execute_full_pipeline()
   797‚Üí        
   798‚Üí        # Cancel timeout
   799‚Üí        signal.alarm(0)
   800‚Üí        
   801‚Üí        # Display results
   802‚Üí        print("\n" + "=" * 80)
   803‚Üí        print("üèÜ PIPELINE EXECUTION COMPLETE")
   804‚Üí        print("=" * 80)
   805‚Üí        
   806‚Üí        if result["success"]:
   807‚Üí            print("‚úÖ SUCCESS: Pipeline executed successfully")
   808‚Üí            print(f"üìä Issues: {result['initial_issues']} ‚Üí {result['final_issues']}")
   809‚Üí            print(f"üìã Report: {result['final_report_path']}")
   810‚Üí            print(f"üìù Logs: {result['log_file']}")
   811‚Üí            
   812‚Üí            if result["final_issues"] == 0:
   813‚Üí                print("üéâ ALL ISSUES RESOLVED - Development branch should be published!")
   814‚Üí            
   815‚Üí            sys.exit(0)
   816‚Üí        else:
   817‚Üí            print("‚ùå FAILURE: Pipeline execution failed")
   818‚Üí            print(f"üí• Error: {result['error']}")
   819‚Üí            print(f"üìù Logs: {result['log_file']}")
   820‚Üí            print(f"üîç State: {result['state_file']}")
   821‚Üí            sys.exit(1)
   822‚Üí            
   823‚Üí    except KeyboardInterrupt:
   824‚Üí        print("\nüõë Pipeline interrupted by user")
   825‚Üí        sys.exit(130)
   826‚Üí    except Exception as e:
   827‚Üí        print(f"\nüí• Pipeline orchestrator error: {e}")
   828‚Üí        import traceback
   829‚Üí        traceback.print_exc()
   830‚Üí        sys.exit(2)
   831‚Üí
   832‚Üíif __name__ == "__main__":
   833‚Üí    main()

#!/usr/bin/env python3
"""
MCP Claude Pipeline - Single Entry Point Master Orchestrator
Complete pipeline from linting to development branch publication with redundancy and monitoring
"""

import os
import sys
import json
import subprocess
import time
import signal
from pathlib import Path
from datetime import datetime
from typing import Dict, List, Any, Optional, Tuple
import click
import threading
import queue
import logging

class MCPClaudePipelineOrchestrator:
    """Master orchestrator that coordinates all linters, quality patcher, and publishing pipeline"""
    
    def __init__(self, repo_path: Path = None):
        self.repo_path = repo_path or Path.cwd()
        self.pipeline_id = datetime.now().strftime("%Y%m%d_%H%M%S")
        self.state_file = self.repo_path / ".mcp-pipeline-state.json"
        
        # Component paths with validation
        self.components = {
            "version_keeper": self.repo_path / "scripts" / "version_keeper.py",
            "quality_patcher": self.repo_path / "scripts" / "claude_quality_patcher.py", 
            "integration_loop": self.repo_path / "scripts" / "claude_code_integration_loop.py",
            "oversight_loop": self.repo_path / "scripts" / "claude_oversight_loop.py"
        }
        
        # Pipeline state and monitoring
        self.pipeline_state = {
            "pipeline_id": self.pipeline_id,
            "start_time": None,
            "current_phase": "initialization",
            "phases_completed": [],
            "phases_failed": [],
            "component_outputs": {},
            "issue_counts": [],
            "monitoring_data": {},
            "redundancy_checkpoints": [],
            "claude_work_assignments": []
        }
        
        # Monitoring and redundancy
        self.monitoring_queue = queue.Queue()
        self.redundancy_backups = {}
        self.component_health = {}
        
        # Setup logging
        self.setup_logging()
        self.validate_components()
        
    def setup_logging(self):
        """Setup comprehensive logging system"""
        log_dir = self.repo_path / ".mcp-pipeline-logs"
        log_dir.mkdir(exist_ok=True)
        
        self.log_file = log_dir / f"pipeline_{self.pipeline_id}.log"
        
        logging.basicConfig(
            level=logging.INFO,
            format='%(asctime)s - %(levelname)s - %(message)s',
            handlers=[
                logging.FileHandler(self.log_file),
                logging.StreamHandler(sys.stdout)
            ]
        )
        self.logger = logging.getLogger("MCPPipeline")
        
    def validate_components(self):
        """Validate all required components exist and are executable"""
        self.logger.info("üîç Validating pipeline components...")
        
        missing_components = []
        for name, path in self.components.items():
            if not path.exists():
                missing_components.append(f"{name}: {path}")
            else:
                self.component_health[name] = "healthy"
                
        if missing_components:
            self.logger.error(f"‚ùå Missing components: {missing_components}")
            raise FileNotFoundError(f"Required components missing: {missing_components}")
            
        self.logger.info("‚úÖ All pipeline components validated")
        
    def save_pipeline_state(self):
        """Save current pipeline state with redundancy"""
        try:
            # Primary state file
            with open(self.state_file, 'w') as f:
                json.dump(self.pipeline_state, f, indent=2, default=str)
                
            # Redundancy backup
            backup_file = self.state_file.with_suffix(f".backup_{int(time.time())}.json")
            with open(backup_file, 'w') as f:
                json.dump(self.pipeline_state, f, indent=2, default=str)
                
            self.redundancy_backups[backup_file.name] = backup_file
            
            # Keep only last 5 backups
            if len(self.redundancy_backups) > 5:
                oldest = min(self.redundancy_backups.keys())
                oldest_file = self.redundancy_backups.pop(oldest)
                oldest_file.unlink(missing_ok=True)
                
        except Exception as e:
            self.logger.error(f"Failed to save pipeline state: {e}")
            
    def load_pipeline_state(self) -> bool:
        """Load existing pipeline state for resumption"""
        if self.state_file.exists():
            try:
                with open(self.state_file, 'r') as f:
                    loaded_state = json.load(f)
                    self.pipeline_state.update(loaded_state)
                    self.logger.info(f"üìÇ Loaded existing pipeline state: {loaded_state.get('pipeline_id')}")
                    return True
            except Exception as e:
                self.logger.warning(f"Could not load pipeline state: {e}")
        return False
        
    def start_monitoring_thread(self):
        """Start background monitoring thread"""
        def monitor():
            while True:
                try:
                    # Check component health
                    for name, path in self.components.items():
                        if path.exists():
                            self.component_health[name] = "healthy"
                        else:
                            self.component_health[name] = "missing"
                            
                    # Update monitoring data
                    self.pipeline_state["monitoring_data"] = {
                        "timestamp": datetime.now().isoformat(),
                        "component_health": self.component_health.copy(),
                        "memory_usage": self.get_memory_usage(),
                        "disk_usage": self.get_disk_usage()
                    }
                    
                    time.sleep(30)  # Monitor every 30 seconds
                    
                except Exception as e:
                    self.logger.error(f"Monitoring error: {e}")
                    time.sleep(60)
                    
        monitor_thread = threading.Thread(target=monitor, daemon=True)
        monitor_thread.start()
        self.logger.info("üîç Background monitoring started")
        
    def get_memory_usage(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
        """Get system memory usage"""
        try:
            result = subprocess.run(['ps', 'aux'], capture_output=True, text=True)
            python_processes = [line for line in result.stdout.split('\n') if 'python' in line.lower()]
            return {"python_processes": len(python_processes)}
        except:
            return {"error": "could_not_determine"}
            
    def get_disk_usage(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
        """Get disk usage for repo directory"""
        try:
            result = subprocess.run(['du', '-sh', str(self.repo_path)], capture_output=True, text=True)
            return {"repo_size": result.stdout.strip().split()[0] if result.returncode == 0 else "unknown"}
        except:
            return {"error": "could_not_determine"}
            
    def execute_component_with_monitoring(self, component_name: str, command: List[str], 
                                        phase_name: str, timeout: int = 3600) -> Dict[str, Any]:
        """Execute a component with comprehensive monitoring and error handling"""
        self.logger.info(f"üîß Executing {component_name} for phase: {phase_name}")
        
        start_time = datetime.now()
        checkpoint_id = f"{phase_name}_{component_name}_{int(time.time())}"
        
        # Create redundancy checkpoint
        self.create_redundancy_checkpoint(checkpoint_id, {
            "component": component_name,
            "phase": phase_name,
            "command": command,
            "start_time": start_time.isoformat()
        })
        
        try:
            # Execute component
            result = subprocess.run(
                command,
                cwd=self.repo_path,
                capture_output=True,
                text=True,
                timeout=timeout
            )
            
            end_time = datetime.now()
            duration = (end_time - start_time).total_seconds()
            
            # Process and store output
            execution_result = {
                "component": component_name,
                "phase": phase_name,
                "success": result.returncode == 0,
                "return_code": result.returncode,
                "duration_seconds": duration,
                "start_time": start_time.isoformat(),
                "end_time": end_time.isoformat(),
                "stdout": result.stdout,
                "stderr": result.stderr,
                "checkpoint_id": checkpoint_id
            }
            
            # Store component output for inter-component communication
            self.pipeline_state["component_outputs"][component_name] = execution_result
            
            # Extract key metrics for pipeline awareness
            metrics = self.extract_component_metrics(component_name, result.stdout, result.stderr)
            execution_result["metrics"] = metrics
            
            if result.returncode == 0:
                self.logger.info(f"‚úÖ {component_name} completed successfully in {duration:.1f}s")
                self.pipeline_state["phases_completed"].append(phase_name)
            else:
                self.logger.error(f"‚ùå {component_name} failed with code {result.returncode}")
                self.pipeline_state["phases_failed"].append(phase_name)
                
            return execution_result
            
        except subprocess.TimeoutExpired:
            self.logger.error(f"‚è∞ {component_name} timed out after {timeout} seconds")
            return {
                "component": component_name,
                "phase": phase_name,
                "success": False,
                "error": "timeout",
                "timeout_seconds": timeout,
                "checkpoint_id": checkpoint_id
            }
            
        except Exception as e:
            self.logger.error(f"üí• {component_name} execution error: {e}")
            return {
                "component": component_name,
                "phase": phase_name,
                "success": False,
                "error": str(e),
                "checkpoint_id": checkpoint_id
            }
            
        finally:
            self.save_pipeline_state()
            
    def extract_component_metrics(self, component_name: str, stdout: str, stderr: str) -> Dict[str, Any]:
        """Extract key metrics from component output for pipeline coordination"""
        import re  # Import at the top of the method for all components to use
        metrics = {}
        
        if component_name == "version_keeper":
            # Extract lint report info
            if "claude-lint-report" in stdout:
                matches = re.findall(r'claude-lint-report-(\d+-\d+)\.json', stdout)
                if matches:
                    metrics["lint_report_generated"] = f"claude-lint-report-{matches[-1]}.json"
                    
            # Extract issue counts
            if "Total fixes:" in stdout:
                matches = re.findall(r'Total fixes:\s*(\d+)', stdout)
                if matches:
                    metrics["total_issues_found"] = int(matches[0])
                    
        elif component_name == "quality_patcher":
            # Extract fixes applied
            if "Fixes Applied:" in stdout:
                matches = re.findall(r'Fixes Applied:\s*(\d+)', stdout)
                if matches:
                    metrics["fixes_applied"] = int(matches[0])
                    
            # Extract session results
            if "fixes_processed" in stdout:
                try:
                    # Look for JSON session results
                    json_match = re.search(r'\{[^}]*"fixes_applied"[^}]*\}', stdout)
                    if json_match:
                        session_data = json.loads(json_match.group())
                        metrics.update(session_data)
                except:
                    pass
                    
        elif component_name == "integration_loop":
            # Extract cycle information
            if "CYCLE" in stdout:
                matches = re.findall(r'CYCLE (\d+)', stdout)
                if matches:
                    metrics["cycles_completed"] = len(set(matches))
                    metrics["final_cycle"] = int(matches[-1])
                    
            # Extract pipeline execution results
            if "development_branch_published" in stdout:
                metrics["pipeline_executed"] = True
                if "YES" in stdout:
                    metrics["development_branch_published"] = True
                    
        elif component_name == "oversight_loop":
            # Extract oversight workflow results
            if "WORKFLOW COMPLETE" in stdout:
                metrics["workflow_completed"] = True
            if "ALL ISSUES RESOLVED" in stdout:
                metrics["all_issues_resolved"] = True
            if "development_branch_published" in stdout:
                metrics["pipeline_executed"] = True
                if "YES" in stdout:
                    metrics["development_branch_published"] = True
                    
        return metrics
        
    def create_redundancy_checkpoint(self, checkpoint_id: str, data: Dict[str, Any]):
        """Create redundancy checkpoint for recovery"""
        checkpoint_dir = self.repo_path / ".mcp-pipeline-checkpoints"
        checkpoint_dir.mkdir(exist_ok=True)
        
        checkpoint_file = checkpoint_dir / f"{checkpoint_id}.json"
        with open(checkpoint_file, 'w') as f:
            json.dump(data, f, indent=2, default=str)
            
        self.pipeline_state["redundancy_checkpoints"].append({
            "id": checkpoint_id,
            "file": str(checkpoint_file),
            "timestamp": datetime.now().isoformat(),
            "data": data
        })
        
    def check_inter_component_dependencies(self, phase: str) -> bool:
        """Check if dependencies for this phase are satisfied"""
        dependencies = {
            "lint_generation": [],
            "quality_patching": ["lint_generation"],
            "integration_loop": ["lint_generation"],
            "pipeline_publishing": ["integration_loop"]
        }
        
        required_phases = dependencies.get(phase, [])
        for required_phase in required_phases:
            if required_phase not in self.pipeline_state["phases_completed"]:
                self.logger.warning(f"‚ö†Ô∏è Dependency not met: {phase} requires {required_phase}")
                return False
                
        return True
        
    def get_latest_lint_report(self) -> Optional[Path]:
        """Get the latest lint report for component coordination"""
        reports_dir = self.repo_path / "reports"
        if not reports_dir.exists():
            return None
            
        lint_reports = list(reports_dir.glob("claude-lint-report-*.json"))
        if not lint_reports:
            return None
            
        # Return most recent
        return max(lint_reports, key=lambda p: p.stat().st_mtime)
        
    def count_issues_in_latest_report(self) -> int:
        """Count issues in the latest lint report for pipeline coordination"""
        latest_report = self.get_latest_lint_report()
        if not latest_report:
            return 0
            
        try:
            with open(latest_report, 'r') as f:
                report_data = json.load(f)
                
            # Count priority fixes
            priority_fixes = report_data.get("priority_fixes", [])
            return len(priority_fixes)
            
        except Exception as e:
            self.logger.error(f"Error counting issues: {e}")
            return 0
            
    def create_claude_work_assignment(self, task_type: str, context: Dict[str, Any]) -> Dict[str, Any]:
        """Create structured work assignment for Claude with complete context"""
        assignment = {
            "assignment_id": f"{task_type}_{int(time.time())}",
            "task_type": task_type,
            "timestamp": datetime.now().isoformat(),
            "context": context,
            "pipeline_state": self.pipeline_state.copy(),
            "component_outputs": self.pipeline_state["component_outputs"].copy(),
            "latest_metrics": self.extract_latest_metrics(),
            "instructions": self.generate_claude_instructions(task_type, context)
        }
        
        self.pipeline_state["claude_work_assignments"].append(assignment)
        return assignment
        
    def extract_latest_metrics(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
        """Extract latest metrics from all components for Claude context"""
        latest_metrics = {}
        
        for component, output in self.pipeline_state["component_outputs"].items():
            if "metrics" in output:
                latest_metrics[component] = output["metrics"]
                
        # Add current issue count
        latest_metrics["current_issues"] = self.count_issues_in_latest_report()
        latest_metrics["latest_lint_report"] = str(self.get_latest_lint_report()) if self.get_latest_lint_report() else None
        
        return latest_metrics

    def execute_full_pipeline(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
        """Execute the complete pipeline from linting to publication"""
        self.logger.info("üöÄ Starting MCP Claude Pipeline - Full Execution")
        
        self.pipeline_state["start_time"] = datetime.now().isoformat()
        self.pipeline_state["current_phase"] = "pipeline_execution"
        
        # Start background monitoring
        self.start_monitoring_thread()
        
        try:
            # PHASE 1: Comprehensive Linting
            self.logger.info("\nüìä PHASE 1: COMPREHENSIVE LINTING")
            self.pipeline_state["current_phase"] = "lint_generation"
            
            lint_result = self.execute_component_with_monitoring(
                "version_keeper",
                ["python3", str(self.components["version_keeper"]), "--claude-lint", "--detect-duplicates", "--check-connections"],
                "lint_generation",
                timeout=1800
            )
            
            # Don't fail the pipeline if linting finds issues - that's expected!
            # The linter returns non-zero exit code when issues are found, which is normal
            if not lint_result["success"]:
                self.logger.warning(f"‚ö†Ô∏è Linting phase found issues (expected): {lint_result.get('return_code', 'unknown')}")
                # Continue to quality patching phase to fix the issues
                
            # Check issues found
            issues_count = self.count_issues_in_latest_report()
            self.pipeline_state["issue_counts"].append({
                "phase": "initial_lint",
                "count": issues_count,
                "timestamp": datetime.now().isoformat()
            })
            
            self.logger.info(f"üìã Initial lint complete: {issues_count} issues found")
            
            # PHASE 2: Quality Patching Loop
            if issues_count > 0:
                self.logger.info(f"\nüîß PHASE 2: QUALITY PATCHING - {issues_count} ISSUES")
                self.pipeline_state["current_phase"] = "quality_patching"
                
                # Print direct Claude instructions for quality patcher
                self.logger.info("\n" + "="*80)
                self.logger.info("ü§ñ CLAUDE: TIME TO APPLY FIXES!")
                self.logger.info("="*80)
                self.logger.info("üìã INSTRUCTIONS FOR CLAUDE:")
                self.logger.info("1. The quality patcher will show you specific fixes to apply")
                self.logger.info("2. Use your Write/Edit tools to apply each fix exactly as shown")
                self.logger.info("3. The patcher will validate your changes")
                self.logger.info("4. Continue until all fixes are applied")
                self.logger.info(f"üéØ TOTAL ISSUES TO FIX: {issues_count}")
                self.logger.info(f"üìä LINT REPORT: {self.get_latest_lint_report()}")
                self.logger.info("="*80)
                self.logger.info("üöÄ Starting quality patcher now...")
                self.logger.info("="*80 + "\n")
                
                # Execute quality patcher directly - let Claude apply the fixes
                quality_result = self.execute_component_with_monitoring(
                    "quality_patcher",
                    ["python3", str(self.components["quality_patcher"]), 
                     "--lint-report", str(self.get_latest_lint_report()),
                     f"--max-fixes={issues_count}",  # Fix ALL issues
                     "--claude-agent"],  # Use Claude agent mode
                    "direct_quality_patching", 
                    timeout=3600  # 1 hour for quality patching
                )
                
                if not quality_result["success"]:
                    self.logger.error(f"‚ùå Quality patcher failed: {quality_result}")
                    # Continue to report the state even if quality patcher fails
                    self.pipeline_state["current_phase"] = "quality_patching_failed"
                    
                # Check final issues
                final_issues = self.count_issues_in_latest_report()
                self.pipeline_state["issue_counts"].append({
                    "phase": "post_processing",
                    "count": final_issues,
                    "timestamp": datetime.now().isoformat()
                })
                
                self.logger.info(f"üéØ Processing complete: {final_issues} issues remaining")
                
                # Verify pipeline success
                if final_issues == 0:
                    self.logger.info("üéâ ALL ISSUES RESOLVED - Pipeline publishing should be complete")
                    self.pipeline_state["current_phase"] = "completed_successfully"
                else:
                    self.logger.warning(f"‚ö†Ô∏è {final_issues} issues still remain")
                    self.pipeline_state["current_phase"] = "completed_with_remaining_issues"
            else:
                self.logger.info("‚úÖ No issues found - proceeding directly to pipeline publishing")
                self.pipeline_state["current_phase"] = "no_issues_found"
                
            # Generate final comprehensive report
            final_report = self.generate_final_pipeline_report()
            
            return {
                "success": True,
                "pipeline_id": self.pipeline_id,
                "final_phase": self.pipeline_state["current_phase"],
                "initial_issues": self.pipeline_state["issue_counts"][0]["count"] if self.pipeline_state["issue_counts"] else 0,
                "final_issues": self.pipeline_state["issue_counts"][-1]["count"] if self.pipeline_state["issue_counts"] else 0,
                "phases_completed": self.pipeline_state["phases_completed"],
                "component_outputs": self.pipeline_state["component_outputs"],
                "final_report_path": final_report,
                "log_file": str(self.log_file),
                "state_file": str(self.state_file)
            }
            
        except Exception as e:
            self.logger.error(f"üí• Pipeline execution failed: {e}")
            self.pipeline_state["current_phase"] = "failed"
            self.pipeline_state["error"] = str(e)
            
            return {
                "success": False,
                "error": str(e),
                "pipeline_id": self.pipeline_id,
                "phases_completed": self.pipeline_state["phases_completed"],
                "phases_failed": self.pipeline_state["phases_failed"],
                "log_file": str(self.log_file),
                "state_file": str(self.state_file)
            }
            
        finally:
            self.save_pipeline_state()
            
    def generate_final_pipeline_report(self) -> str:
        """Generate comprehensive final pipeline report"""
        report_file = self.repo_path / f"mcp-pipeline-report-{self.pipeline_id}.md"
        
        start_time = datetime.fromisoformat(self.pipeline_state["start_time"])
        end_time = datetime.now()
        total_duration = (end_time - start_time).total_seconds()
        
        # Calculate statistics
        initial_issues = self.pipeline_state["issue_counts"][0]["count"] if self.pipeline_state["issue_counts"] else 0
        final_issues = self.pipeline_state["issue_counts"][-1]["count"] if self.pipeline_state["issue_counts"] else 0
        issues_resolved = initial_issues - final_issues
        
        report_content = f"""# üöÄ MCP Claude Pipeline Execution Report
Generated: {end_time.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S')}
Pipeline ID: {self.pipeline_id}

## üèÜ EXECUTION SUMMARY

### Overall Results
- **Pipeline Success**: {'‚úÖ YES' if self.pipeline_state['current_phase'] in ['completed_successfully', 'no_issues_found'] else '‚ùå NO'}
- **Total Duration**: {total_duration/60:.1f} minutes
- **Final Phase**: {self.pipeline_state['current_phase']}

### Issue Processing
- **Initial Issues**: {initial_issues}
- **Final Issues**: {final_issues}
- **Issues Resolved**: {issues_resolved}
- **Resolution Rate**: {(issues_resolved/max(1, initial_issues)*100):.1f}%

## üìä COMPONENT EXECUTION DETAILS

"""

        # Add component results
        for component, output in self.pipeline_state["component_outputs"].items():
            success_icon = "‚úÖ" if output.get("success", False) else "‚ùå"
            report_content += f"""
### {success_icon} {component.title()}
- **Duration**: {output.get('duration_seconds', 0):.1f} seconds
- **Return Code**: {output.get('return_code', 'unknown')}
- **Phase**: {output.get('phase', 'unknown')}
"""
            if output.get("metrics"):
                report_content += f"- **Key Metrics**: {json.dumps(output['metrics'], indent=2)}\n"
                
        # Add pipeline state information
        report_content += f"""
## üîÑ PIPELINE STATE

### Phases Completed
{chr(10).join('- ' + phase for phase in self.pipeline_state['phases_completed'])}

### Phases Failed

@click.command()
@click.option('--resume', is_flag=True, help='Resume from existing pipeline state')
@click.option('--repo-path', type=click.Path(exists=True), help='Repository path (default: current directory)')
@click.option('--max-duration', default=7200, help='Maximum pipeline duration in seconds (default: 2 hours)')
def main(resume, repo_path, max_duration):
    """
    MCP Claude Pipeline - Single Entry Point Master Orchestrator
    
    Coordinates all linters, quality patcher, and publishing pipeline with:
    ‚Ä¢ Complete component awareness and output sharing
    ‚Ä¢ Redundancy and monitoring systems
    ‚Ä¢ Structured Claude work assignments
    ‚Ä¢ Automatic recovery and checkpointing
    ‚Ä¢ End-to-end pipeline execution
    
    SINGLE LINE EXECUTION:
    python3 mcp-claude-pipeline.py
    """
    
    print("üöÄ MCP CLAUDE PIPELINE - MASTER ORCHESTRATOR")
    print("=" * 80)
    print("üì¶ Single entry point for complete linting ‚Üí quality patching ‚Üí publishing")
    print("üîÑ All components aware of each other's output with redundancy monitoring")
    print("ü§ñ Claude operates as worker with structured assignments and full context")
    print()
    
    try:
        # Initialize orchestrator
        repo_path = Path(repo_path) if repo_path else Path.cwd()
        orchestrator = MCPClaudePipelineOrchestrator(repo_path)
        
        # Resume existing pipeline if requested
        if resume:
            if orchestrator.load_pipeline_state():
                print("üìÇ Resuming from existing pipeline state...")
            else:
                print("‚ö†Ô∏è No existing state found, starting fresh pipeline...")
                
        # Set up timeout handler
        def timeout_handler(signum, frame):
            orchestrator.logger.error(f"‚è∞ Pipeline timed out after {max_duration} seconds")
            raise TimeoutError(f"Pipeline execution exceeded {max_duration} seconds")
            
        signal.signal(signal.SIGALRM, timeout_handler)
        signal.alarm(max_duration)
        
        # Execute full pipeline
        result = orchestrator.execute_full_pipeline()
        
        # Cancel timeout
        signal.alarm(0)
        
        # Display results
        print("\n" + "=" * 80)
        print("üèÜ PIPELINE EXECUTION COMPLETE")
        print("=" * 80)
        
        if result["success"]:
            print("‚úÖ SUCCESS: Pipeline executed successfully")
            print(f"üìä Issues: {result['initial_issues']} ‚Üí {result['final_issues']}")
            print(f"üìã Report: {result['final_report_path']}")
            print(f"üìù Logs: {result['log_file']}")
            
            if result["final_issues"] == 0:
                print("üéâ ALL ISSUES RESOLVED - Development branch should be published!")
            
            sys.exit(0)
        else:
            print("‚ùå FAILURE: Pipeline execution failed")
            print(f"üí• Error: {result['error']}")
            print(f"üìù Logs: {result['log_file']}")
            print(f"üîç State: {result['state_file']}")
            sys.exit(1)
            
    except KeyboardInterrupt:
        print("\nüõë Pipeline interrupted by user")
        sys.exit(130)
    except Exception as e:
        print(f"\nüí• Pipeline orchestrator error: {e}")
        import traceback
        traceback.print_exc()
        sys.exit(2)

if __name__ == "__main__":
    main()

   334‚ÜíFILE: {file_path}
   335‚ÜíLINE: {line_num}
   336‚ÜíERROR: {error_msg}
   337‚Üí
   338‚ÜíFocus on this specific line only. Check surrounding context for proper fix.
   339‚Üí"""
   340‚Üí        
   341‚Üí        elif fix_type == "security_fix":
   342‚Üí            file_path = fix.get("file", "")
   343‚Üí            line_num = fix.get("line", "")
   344‚Üí            severity = fix.get("severity", "")
   345‚Üí            
   346‚Üí            return f"""
   347‚ÜíSECURITY ISSUE in {file_path}:{line_num}
   348‚ÜíSEVERITY: {severity}
   349‚Üí
   350‚ÜíThis is a security vulnerability. Fix carefully to maintain functionality while removing the security risk.
   351‚Üí"""
   352‚Üí        
   353‚Üí        elif fix_type == "remove_duplicate":
   354‚Üí            return "This is a duplicate function removal. Ensure no other code depends on this specific instance before removing."
   355‚Üí        
   356‚Üí        elif fix_type in ["fix_undefined_function", "fix_broken_import"]:
   357‚Üí            file_path = fix.get("file", "").split("/")[-1] if fix.get("file") else ""
   358‚Üí            line_num = fix.get("line", "")
   359‚Üí            
   360‚Üí            return f"""
   361‚ÜíCONNECTION ISSUE in {file_path}:{line_num}
   362‚Üí
   363‚ÜíThis may be a false positive from static analysis. Verify the issue actually exists before fixing.
   364‚Üí"""
   365‚Üí        
   366‚Üí        return "Standard fix - follow the claude_prompt instructions carefully."
   367‚Üí    
   368‚Üí    def validate_fix_applied(self, fix_item: Dict[str, Any], file_path: str) -> Dict[str, Any]:
   369‚Üí        """Validate that a fix was applied correctly"""
   370‚Üí        print(f"üîç Validating fix applied to {file_path}...")
   371‚Üí        
   372‚Üí        validation_result = {
   373‚Üí            "syntax_valid": False,
   374‚Üí            "fix_applied": False,
   375‚Üí            "errors": [],
   376‚Üí            "warnings": []
   377‚Üí        }
   378‚Üí        
   379‚Üí        # Check Python syntax if it's a Python file
   380‚Üí        if file_path.endswith('.py'):
   381‚Üí            try:
   382‚Üí                with open(file_path, 'r') as f:
   383‚Üí                    content = f.read()
   384‚Üí                
   385‚Üí                compile(content, file_path, 'exec')
   386‚Üí                validation_result["syntax_valid"] = True
   387‚Üí                print("  ‚úÖ Python syntax valid")
   388‚Üí                
   389‚Üí            except SyntaxError as e:
   390‚Üí                validation_result["errors"].append(f"Syntax error: {e}")
   391‚Üí                print(f"  ‚ùå Syntax error: {e}")
   392‚Üí                return validation_result
   393‚Üí            
   394‚Üí            except Exception as e:
   395‚Üí                validation_result["errors"].append(f"Validation error: {e}")
   396‚Üí                print(f"  ‚ö†Ô∏è Validation error: {e}")
   397‚Üí        
   398‚Üí        # Check if fix was actually applied based on fix type
   399‚Üí        fix = fix_item.get("fix", {})
   400‚Üí        fix_type = fix.get("type", "")
   401‚Üí        
   402‚Üí        if fix_type == "manual_fix":
   403‚Üí            # For manual fixes, run the specific linter to see if issue is resolved
   404‚Üí            line_num = fix.get("line", "")
   405‚Üí            error_code = fix.get("code", "")
   406‚Üí            
   407‚Üí            if error_code and line_num:
   408‚Üí                # Run flake8 on specific line
   409‚Üí                result = subprocess.run([
   410‚Üí                    "flake8", "--select", error_code, f"--max-line-length=120",
   411‚Üí                    file_path
   412‚Üí                ], capture_output=True, text=True)
   413‚Üí                
   414‚Üí                if f":{line_num}:" not in result.stdout:
   415‚Üí                    validation_result["fix_applied"] = True
   416‚Üí                    print(f"  ‚úÖ Fix applied - {error_code} error resolved")
   417‚Üí                else:
   418‚Üí                    validation_result["warnings"].append(f"Fix may not be complete - {error_code} still present")
   419‚Üí                    print(f"  ‚ö†Ô∏è Fix may not be complete - {error_code} still present")
   420‚Üí        
   421‚Üí        elif fix_type == "auto_fix":
   422‚Üí            # Auto-fixes should always be valid
   423‚Üí            validation_result["fix_applied"] = True
   424‚Üí            print("  ‚úÖ Auto-fix applied")
   425‚Üí        
   426‚Üí        else:
   427‚Üí            # For other types, assume applied if syntax is valid
   428‚Üí            validation_result["fix_applied"] = validation_result["syntax_valid"]
   429‚Üí        
   430‚Üí        return validation_result
