   432‚Üí    def create_backup(self, file_path: str) -> str:
   433‚Üí        """Create backup of file before fixing"""
   434‚Üí        backup_dir = self.repo_path / ".claude_patches" / "backups"
   435‚Üí        backup_dir.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)
   436‚Üí        
   437‚Üí        timestamp = datetime.now().strftime("%Y%m%d_%H%M%S")
   438‚Üí        file_name = Path(file_path).name
   439‚Üí        backup_path = backup_dir / f"{file_name}.{timestamp}.backup"
   440‚Üí        
   441‚Üí        try:
   442‚Üí            shutil.copy2(file_path, backup_path)
   443‚Üí            print(f"  üíæ Backup created: {backup_path}")
   444‚Üí            return str(backup_path)
   445‚Üí        except Exception as e:
   446‚Üí            print(f"  ‚ö†Ô∏è Backup failed: {e}")
   447‚Üí            return ""
   448‚Üí    
   449‚Üí    def analyze_diff_and_restore_deleted(self, file_path: str, backup_path: str, target_lines: List[int] = None) -> Dict[str, Any]:
   450‚Üí        """Advanced diff analysis with surgical restoration of unintentionally deleted code"""
   451‚Üí        if not backup_path or not Path(backup_path).exists():
   452‚Üí            return {"restored": False, "reason": "no_backup"}
   453‚Üí        
   454‚Üí        try:
   455‚Üí            # Read both files
   456‚Üí            with open(file_path, 'r') as f:
   457‚Üí                current_lines = f.readlines()
   458‚Üí            
   459‚Üí            with open(backup_path, 'r') as f:
   460‚Üí                backup_lines = f.readlines()
   461‚Üí            
   462‚Üí            print(f"  üîç DIFF ANALYSIS: Comparing {len(current_lines)} vs {len(backup_lines)} lines")
   463‚Üí            
   464‚Üí            # Generate unified diff
   465‚Üí            diff = list(difflib.unified_diff(
   466‚Üí                backup_lines, 
   467‚Üí                current_lines,
   468‚Üí                fromfile=f"{file_path}.backup",
   469‚Üí                tofile=file_path,
   470‚Üí                lineterm=''
   471‚Üí            ))
   472‚Üí            
   473‚Üí            if not diff:
   474‚Üí                print(f"  ‚úÖ No differences detected")
   475‚Üí                return {"restored": False, "reason": "no_changes"}
   476‚Üí            
   477‚Üí            # Analyze deletions and modifications
   478‚Üí            deleted_lines = []
   479‚Üí            modified_lines = []
   480‚Üí            added_lines = []
   481‚Üí            
   482‚Üí            i = 0
   483‚Üí            while i < len(diff):
   484‚Üí                line = diff[i]
   485‚Üí                if line.startswith('@@'):
   486‚Üí                    # Parse hunk header to get line numbers
   487‚Üí                    match = re.match(r'@@ -(\d+),?(\d*) \+(\d+),?(\d*) @@', line)
   488‚Üí                    if match:
   489‚Üí                        old_start = int(match.group(1))
   490‚Üí                        new_start = int(match.group(3))
   491‚Üí                        
   492‚Üí                        # Analyze changes in this hunk
   493‚Üí                        i += 1
   494‚Üí                        while i < len(diff) and not diff[i].startswith('@@'):
   495‚Üí                            if diff[i].startswith('-'):
   496‚Üí                                deleted_lines.append({
   497‚Üí                                    'line_num': old_start + len([l for l in deleted_lines if l.get('hunk_start', 0) == old_start]),
   498‚Üí                                    'content': diff[i][1:],
   499‚Üí                                    'hunk_start': old_start
   500‚Üí                                })
   501‚Üí                            elif diff[i].startswith('+'):
   502‚Üí                                added_lines.append({
   503‚Üí                                    'line_num': new_start + len([l for l in added_lines if l.get('hunk_start', 0) == new_start]),
   504‚Üí                                    'content': diff[i][1:],
   505‚Üí                                    'hunk_start': new_start
   506‚Üí                                })
   507‚Üí                            i += 1
   508‚Üí                else:
   509‚Üí                    i += 1
   510‚Üí            
   511‚Üí            print(f"  üìä DIFF SUMMARY:")
   512‚Üí            print(f"    Deleted lines: {len(deleted_lines)}")
   513‚Üí            print(f"    Added lines: {len(added_lines)}")
   514‚Üí            print(f"    Target lines for fix: {target_lines}")
   515‚Üí            
   516‚Üí            # Determine which deletions are unintentional
   517‚Üí            unintentional_deletions = []
   518‚Üí            if target_lines:
   519‚Üí                for deletion in deleted_lines:
   520‚Üí                    if deletion['line_num'] not in target_lines:
   521‚Üí                        # Check if this deletion looks unintentional
   522‚Üí                        content = deletion['content'].strip()
   523‚Üí                        if self.is_likely_unintentional_deletion(content):
   524‚Üí                            unintentional_deletions.append(deletion)
   525‚Üí            else:
   526‚Üí                # If no target lines specified, check for critical deletions
   527‚Üí                for deletion in deleted_lines:
   528‚Üí                    content = deletion['content'].strip()
   529‚Üí                    if self.is_critical_code_deletion(content):
   530‚Üí                        unintentional_deletions.append(deletion)
   531‚Üí            
   532‚Üí            if not unintentional_deletions:
   533‚Üí                print(f"  ‚úÖ All deletions appear intentional")
   534‚Üí                return {"restored": False, "reason": "no_unintentional_deletions", "analysis": {
   535‚Üí                    "deleted_lines": len(deleted_lines),
   536‚Üí                    "added_lines": len(added_lines)
   537‚Üí                }}
   538‚Üí            
   539‚Üí            # Perform surgical restoration
   540‚Üí            print(f"  üîß SURGICAL RESTORATION: Restoring {len(unintentional_deletions)} unintentionally deleted lines")
   541‚Üí            restoration_result = self.perform_surgical_restoration(
   542‚Üí                file_path, current_lines, unintentional_deletions, target_lines
   543‚Üí            )
   544‚Üí            
   545‚Üí            return {
   546‚Üí                "restored": restoration_result['success'],
   547‚Üí                "lines_restored": restoration_result.get('lines_restored', 0),
   548‚Üí                "analysis": {
   549‚Üí                    "deleted_lines": len(deleted_lines),
   550‚Üí                    "added_lines": len(added_lines),
   551‚Üí                    "unintentional_deletions": len(unintentional_deletions),
   552‚Üí                    "restoration_details": restoration_result
   553‚Üí                }
   554‚Üí            }
   555‚Üí            
   556‚Üí        except Exception as e:
   557‚Üí            print(f"  ‚ùå DIFF ANALYSIS ERROR: {e}")
   558‚Üí            return {"restored": False, "reason": f"analysis_error: {e}"}
   559‚Üí    
   560‚Üí    def is_likely_unintentional_deletion(self, content: str) -> bool:
   561‚Üí        """Detect if a deleted line was likely unintentional"""
   562‚Üí        content = content.strip()
   563‚Üí        
   564‚Üí        # Empty lines or comments are usually safe to delete
   565‚Üí        if not content or content.startswith('#'):
   566‚Üí            return False
   567‚Üí        
   568‚Üí        # Function definitions, class definitions, imports are critical
   569‚Üí        critical_patterns = [
   570‚Üí            r'^def\s+\w+',          # function definitions
   571‚Üí            r'^class\s+\w+',        # class definitions  
   572‚Üí            r'^import\s+',          # imports
   573‚Üí            r'^from\s+.+\s+import', # from imports
   574‚Üí            r'^@\w+',               # decorators
   575‚Üí            r'^\s*return\s+',       # return statements
   576‚Üí            r'^\s*raise\s+',        # raise statements
   577‚Üí            r'^\s*if\s+__name__',   # main guard
   578‚Üí            r'^\s*try:',            # try blocks
   579‚Üí            r'^\s*except\s*',       # except blocks
   580‚Üí            r'^\s*finally:',        # finally blocks
   581‚Üí            r'^\s*with\s+',         # with statements
   582‚Üí        ]
   583‚Üí        
   584‚Üí        for pattern in critical_patterns:
   585‚Üí            if re.match(pattern, content):
   586‚Üí                print(f"    üö® CRITICAL DELETION: {content[:50]}...")
   587‚Üí                return True
   588‚Üí        
   589‚Üí        # Lines with significant code content
   590‚Üí        if len(content) > 10 and any(char in content for char in '(){}[]="\''):
   591‚Üí            print(f"    ‚ö†Ô∏è  SUSPICIOUS DELETION: {content[:50]}...")
   592‚Üí            return True
   593‚Üí        
   594‚Üí        return False
   595‚Üí    
   596‚Üí    def is_critical_code_deletion(self, content: str) -> bool:
   597‚Üí        """Detect critical code that should never be deleted"""
   598‚Üí        content = content.strip()
   599‚Üí        
   600‚Üí        critical_patterns = [
   601‚Üí            r'^def\s+\w+',          # function definitions
   602‚Üí            r'^class\s+\w+',        # class definitions
   603‚Üí            r'^import\s+',          # imports
   604‚Üí            r'^from\s+.+\s+import', # from imports
   605‚Üí            r'^\s*return\s+',       # return statements
   606‚Üí            r'^\s*if\s+__name__',   # main guard
   607‚Üí        ]
   608‚Üí        
   609‚Üí        return any(re.match(pattern, content) for pattern in critical_patterns)
   610‚Üí    
   611‚Üí    def perform_surgical_restoration(self, file_path: str, current_lines: List[str], 
   612‚Üí                                   unintentional_deletions: List[Dict], target_lines: List[int] = None) -> Dict[str, Any]:
   613‚Üí        """Perform surgical restoration without overwriting or misplacing lines"""
   614‚Üí        try:
   615‚Üí            print(f"    üè• SURGICAL RESTORATION: Processing {len(unintentional_deletions)} deletions")
   616‚Üí            
   617‚Üí            # Sort deletions by line number (descending to avoid line number shifts)
   618‚Üí            deletions_sorted = sorted(unintentional_deletions, key=lambda x: x['line_num'], reverse=True)
   619‚Üí            
   620‚Üí            restored_lines = 0
   621‚Üí            restoration_log = []
   622‚Üí            modified_lines = current_lines.copy()
   623‚Üí            
   624‚Üí            for deletion in deletions_sorted:
   625‚Üí                line_num = deletion['line_num']
   626‚Üí                content = deletion['content']
   627‚Üí                
   628‚Üí                # Find the best insertion point
   629‚Üí                insertion_point = self.find_safe_insertion_point(
   630‚Üí                    modified_lines, line_num, content, target_lines
   631‚Üí                )
   632‚Üí                
   633‚Üí                if insertion_point is not None:
   634‚Üí                    # Insert the line at the safe location
   635‚Üí                    modified_lines.insert(insertion_point, content)
   636‚Üí                    restored_lines += 1
   637‚Üí                    
   638‚Üí                    restoration_log.append({
   639‚Üí                        'original_line': line_num,
   640‚Üí                        'restored_at': insertion_point + 1,  # 1-indexed for display
   641‚Üí                        'content': content.strip()
   642‚Üí                    })
   643‚Üí                    
   644‚Üí                    print(f"      ‚úÖ Restored line {line_num} ‚Üí {insertion_point + 1}: {content.strip()[:40]}...")
   645‚Üí                else:
   646‚Üí                    print(f"      ‚ö†Ô∏è  Could not safely restore line {line_num}: {content.strip()[:40]}...")
   647‚Üí                    restoration_log.append({
   648‚Üí                        'original_line': line_num,
   649‚Üí                        'restored_at': None,
   650‚Üí                        'content': content.strip(),
   651‚Üí                        'reason': 'no_safe_insertion_point'
   652‚Üí                    })
   653‚Üí            
   654‚Üí            if restored_lines > 0:
   655‚Üí                # Write the restored content back to file
   656‚Üí                with open(file_path, 'w') as f:
   657‚Üí                    f.writelines(modified_lines)
   658‚Üí                
   659‚Üí                print(f"    ‚úÖ RESTORATION COMPLETE: {restored_lines} lines restored")
   660‚Üí            
   661‚Üí            return {
   662‚Üí                'success': restored_lines > 0,
   663‚Üí                'lines_restored': restored_lines,
   664‚Üí                'restoration_log': restoration_log,
   665‚Üí                'total_deletions': len(unintentional_deletions)
   666‚Üí            }
   667‚Üí            
   668‚Üí        except Exception as e:
   669‚Üí            print(f"    ‚ùå SURGICAL RESTORATION ERROR: {e}")
   670‚Üí            return {'success': False, 'error': str(e)}
   671‚Üí    
   672‚Üí    def find_safe_insertion_point(self, lines: List[str], original_line: int, content: str, 
   673‚Üí                                 target_lines: List[int] = None) -> Optional[int]:
   674‚Üí        """Find a safe place to insert a restored line without disrupting structure"""
   675‚Üí        content_stripped = content.strip()
   676‚Üí        
   677‚Üí        # Try to insert at or near the original location
   678‚Üí        if original_line <= len(lines):
   679‚Üí            # Check if we can insert at the exact original location
   680‚Üí            insertion_candidate = original_line - 1  # Convert to 0-indexed
   681‚Üí            
   682‚Üí            # Ensure we don't insert in the middle of target fix lines
   683‚Üí            if target_lines:
   684‚Üí                # Find a gap between target lines or before/after the target block
   685‚Üí                target_lines_sorted = sorted(target_lines)
   686‚Üí                
   687‚Üí                # Try inserting before the target block
   688‚Üí                if insertion_candidate < target_lines_sorted[0] - 1:
   689‚Üí                    return max(0, insertion_candidate)
   690‚Üí                
   691‚Üí                # Try inserting after the target block
   692‚Üí                if insertion_candidate > target_lines_sorted[-1]:
   693‚Üí                    return min(len(lines), insertion_candidate)
   694‚Üí                
   695‚Üí                # Find gaps within target lines
   696‚Üí                for i in range(len(target_lines_sorted) - 1):
   697‚Üí                    gap_start = target_lines_sorted[i]
   698‚Üí                    gap_end = target_lines_sorted[i + 1]
   699‚Üí                    
   700‚Üí                    if gap_end - gap_start > 1 and gap_start <= insertion_candidate < gap_end:
   701‚Üí                        return insertion_candidate
   702‚Üí            else:
   703‚Üí                # No target lines restriction - insert at original location
   704‚Üí                return max(0, min(len(lines), insertion_candidate))
   705‚Üí        
   706‚Üí        # Fallback: find contextually appropriate location
   707‚Üí        if content_stripped.startswith('import ') or content_stripped.startswith('from '):
   708‚Üí            # Insert with other imports at the top
   709‚Üí            for i, line in enumerate(lines):
   710‚Üí                if not (line.strip().startswith('import ') or line.strip().startswith('from ') or 
   711‚Üí                       line.strip().startswith('#') or not line.strip()):
   712‚Üí                    return i
   713‚Üí            return 0
   714‚Üí        
   715‚Üí        elif content_stripped.startswith('def ') or content_stripped.startswith('class '):
   716‚Üí            # Insert at module level (not inside other functions)
   717‚Üí            return len(lines)
   718‚Üí        
   719‚Üí        # Default: insert at the end
   720‚Üí        return len(lines)
   721‚Üí    
   722‚Üí    def verify_file_modification(self, file_path: str, backup_path: str) -> bool:
   723‚Üí        """Verify that Claude actually modified the file"""
   724‚Üí        if not backup_path or not Path(backup_path).exists():
   725‚Üí            return True  # Can't verify, assume modified
   726‚Üí        
   727‚Üí        try:
   728‚Üí            # Compare file contents
   729‚Üí            with open(file_path, 'r') as f:
   730‚Üí                current_content = f.read()
   731‚Üí            
   732‚Üí            with open(backup_path, 'r') as f:
   733‚Üí                backup_content = f.read()
   734‚Üí            
   735‚Üí            # Check if content changed
   736‚Üí            if current_content == backup_content:
   737‚Üí                print(f"  üö® FILE NOT MODIFIED: {file_path}")
   738‚Üí                return False
   739‚Üí            
   740‚Üí            # Check modification time
   741‚Üí            current_mtime = Path(file_path).stat().st_mtime
   742‚Üí            backup_mtime = Path(backup_path).stat().st_mtime
   743‚Üí            
   744‚Üí            if current_mtime <= backup_mtime:
   745‚Üí                print(f"  üö® FILE NOT UPDATED: modification time unchanged")
   746‚Üí                return False
   747‚Üí            
   748‚Üí            print(f"  ‚úÖ FILE MODIFIED: Claude made changes to {file_path}")
   749‚Üí            return True
   750‚Üí            
   751‚Üí        except Exception as e:
   752‚Üí            print(f"  ‚ö†Ô∏è Could not verify modification: {e}")
   753‚Üí            return True  # Assume modified if can't verify
   754‚Üí    
   755‚Üí    def validate_line_level_changes(self, fix_item: Dict[str, Any], file_path: str, backup_path: str) -> Dict[str, Any]:
   756‚Üí        """Validate that Claude only modified the specific lines mentioned in the issue"""
   757‚Üí        print(f"  üîç Validating line-level changes...")
   758‚Üí        
   759‚Üí        validation_result = {
   760‚Üí            "valid_changes": True,
   761‚Üí            "unauthorized_changes": [],
   762‚Üí            "target_lines_modified": False,
   763‚Üí            "errors": []
   764‚Üí        }
   765‚Üí        
   766‚Üí        try:
   767‚Üí            # Read current and backup content
   768‚Üí            with open(file_path, 'r') as f:
   769‚Üí                current_lines = f.readlines()
   770‚Üí            
   771‚Üí            with open(backup_path, 'r') as f:
   772‚Üí                backup_lines = f.readlines()
   773‚Üí            
   774‚Üí            # Extract target line numbers from fix
   775‚Üí            target_lines = self.extract_target_lines(fix_item)
   776‚Üí            print(f"    üìç Target lines to modify: {target_lines}")
   777‚Üí            
   778‚Üí            # Compare line by line
   779‚Üí            max_lines = max(len(current_lines), len(backup_lines))
   780‚Üí            changed_lines = []
   781‚Üí            
   782‚Üí            for line_num in range(max_lines):
   783‚Üí                current_line = current_lines[line_num] if line_num < len(current_lines) else ""
   784‚Üí                backup_line = backup_lines[line_num] if line_num < len(backup_lines) else ""
   785‚Üí                
   786‚Üí                if current_line != backup_line:
   787‚Üí                    changed_lines.append(line_num + 1)  # 1-indexed
   788‚Üí            
   789‚Üí            print(f"    üìù Lines actually changed: {changed_lines}")
   790‚Üí            
   791‚Üí            # Check if target lines were modified
   792‚Üí            if target_lines:
   793‚Üí                target_modified = any(line in changed_lines for line in target_lines)
   794‚Üí                validation_result["target_lines_modified"] = target_modified
   795‚Üí                
   796‚Üí                if not target_modified:
   797‚Üí                    validation_result["errors"].append(f"Target lines {target_lines} were not modified")
   798‚Üí            
   799‚Üí            # Check for unauthorized changes
   800‚Üí            if target_lines:
   801‚Üí                unauthorized = [line for line in changed_lines if line not in target_lines]
   802‚Üí                if unauthorized:
   803‚Üí                    validation_result["unauthorized_changes"] = unauthorized
   804‚Üí                    validation_result["valid_changes"] = False
   805‚Üí                    validation_result["errors"].append(f"Unauthorized changes to lines: {unauthorized}")
   806‚Üí                    print(f"    üö® UNAUTHORIZED CHANGES: Claude modified lines {unauthorized} not mentioned in issue")
   807‚Üí                else:
   808‚Üí                    print(f"    ‚úÖ AUTHORIZED CHANGES: Claude only modified target lines")
   809‚Üí            else:
   810‚Üí                # If no specific lines mentioned, allow reasonable changes
   811‚Üí                print(f"    ‚ö†Ô∏è No specific target lines - allowing changes to {len(changed_lines)} lines")
   812‚Üí            
   813‚Üí            return validation_result
   814‚Üí            
   815‚Üí        except Exception as e:
   816‚Üí            validation_result["errors"].append(f"Line validation error: {e}")
   817‚Üí            print(f"    ‚ùå Line validation error: {e}")
   818‚Üí            return validation_result
   819‚Üí    
   820‚Üí    def extract_target_lines(self, fix_item: Dict[str, Any]) -> List[int]:
   821‚Üí        """Extract target line numbers from fix description"""
   822‚Üí        fix = fix_item.get("fix", {})
   823‚Üí        description = fix.get("description", "")
   824‚Üí        claude_prompt = fix.get("claude_prompt", "")
   825‚Üí        line_hint = fix.get("line", "")
   826‚Üí        
   827‚Üí        target_lines = []
   828‚Üí        
   829‚Üí        # Check for explicit line number in fix data
   830‚Üí        if line_hint and str(line_hint).isdigit():
   831‚Üí            target_lines.append(int(line_hint))
   832‚Üí        
   833‚Üí        # Extract line numbers from text descriptions
   834‚Üí        text = f"{description} {claude_prompt}"
   835‚Üí        
   836‚Üí        # Look for patterns like ":123", "line 123", "lines 123-125"
   837‚Üí        line_patterns = [
   838‚Üí            r':(\d+)',  # file.py:123
   839‚Üí            r'line\s+(\d+)',  # line 123
   840‚Üí            r'lines?\s+(\d+)(?:-(\d+))?',  # line 123 or lines 123-125
   841‚Üí        ]
   842‚Üí        
   843‚Üí        for pattern in line_patterns:
   844‚Üí            matches = re.findall(pattern, text, re.IGNORECASE)
   845‚Üí            for match in matches:
   846‚Üí                if isinstance(match, tuple):
   847‚Üí                    # Handle range like 123-125
   848‚Üí                    start = int(match[0])
   849‚Üí                    end = int(match[1]) if match[1] else start
   850‚Üí                    target_lines.extend(range(start, end + 1))
   851‚Üí                else:
   852‚Üí                    target_lines.append(int(match))
   853‚Üí        
   854‚Üí        return sorted(list(set(target_lines)))  # Remove duplicates and sort
   855‚Üí    
   856‚Üí    def cleanup_backup_if_successful(self, backup_path: str, line_validation: Dict[str, Any]) -> bool:
   857‚Üí        """Clean up backup file if fix was successful and no violations found"""
   858‚Üí        if not backup_path or not Path(backup_path).exists():
   859‚Üí            return False
   860‚Üí        
   861‚Üí        # Only cleanup if fix was completely successful with no violations
   862‚Üí        if line_validation.get("valid_changes", False) and not line_validation.get("errors", []):
   863‚Üí            try:
   864‚Üí                Path(backup_path).unlink()
   865‚Üí                print(f"  üßπ Backup cleaned up: {Path(backup_path).name}")
   866‚Üí                return True
   867‚Üí            except Exception as e:
   868‚Üí                print(f"  ‚ö†Ô∏è Could not cleanup backup: {e}")
   869‚Üí                return False
   870‚Üí        else:
   871‚Üí            print(f"  üíæ Backup retained due to validation issues: {Path(backup_path).name}")
   872‚Üí            return False

   874‚Üí    def run_step_by_step_fixes(self, max_fixes: int = 10, interactive: bool = True) -> Dict[str, Any]:
   875‚Üí        """Run step-by-step fixing process with Claude"""
   876‚Üí        print("\nüöÄ Starting Step-by-Step Claude Fixing Process")
   877‚Üí        print("=" * 60)
   878‚Üí        
   879‚Üí        priority_fixes = self.get_priority_fixes()
   880‚Üí        
   881‚Üí        if not priority_fixes:
   882‚Üí            print("‚ùå No safe fixes found in lint report")
   883‚Üí            return {"status": "no_fixes", "total_fixes": 0}
   884‚Üí        
   885‚Üí        print(f"üìã Found {len(priority_fixes)} fixes to apply")
   886‚Üí        print(f"üéØ Will apply maximum {max_fixes} fixes in this session")
   887‚Üí        
   888‚Üí        session_results = {
   889‚Üí            "session_start": datetime.now().isoformat(),
   890‚Üí            "fixes_processed": [],
   891‚Üí            "fixes_applied": 0,
   892‚Üí            "fixes_skipped": 0, 
   893‚Üí            "fixes_failed": 0,
   894‚Üí            "total_available": len(priority_fixes)
   895‚Üí        }
   896‚Üí        
   897‚Üí        # Process fixes one by one
   898‚Üí        for i, fix_item in enumerate(priority_fixes[:max_fixes]):
   899‚Üí            print(f"\n{'='*60}")
   900‚Üí            print(f"üîß FIX {i+1}/{min(max_fixes, len(priority_fixes))}")
   901‚Üí            print(f"{'='*60}")
   902‚Üí            
   903‚Üí            fix_result = self.process_single_fix(fix_item, interactive)
   904‚Üí            session_results["fixes_processed"].append(fix_result)
   905‚Üí            
   906‚Üí            if fix_result["status"] == "applied":
   907‚Üí                session_results["fixes_applied"] += 1
   908‚Üí                self.fixes_applied += 1
   909‚Üí            elif fix_result["status"] == "skipped":
   910‚Üí                session_results["fixes_skipped"] += 1
   911‚Üí                self.fixes_skipped += 1
   912‚Üí            else:
   913‚Üí                session_results["fixes_failed"] += 1
   914‚Üí                self.fixes_failed += 1
   915‚Üí            
   916‚Üí            # Pause between fixes for safety
   917‚Üí            if i < len(priority_fixes) - 1:
   918‚Üí                print("\n‚è∏Ô∏è  Pausing 2 seconds between fixes for safety...")
   919‚Üí                time.sleep(2)
   920‚Üí        
   921‚Üí        session_results["session_end"] = datetime.now().isoformat()
   922‚Üí        return session_results

   924‚Üí    def process_single_fix(self, fix_item: Dict[str, Any], interactive: bool = True) -> Dict[str, Any]:
   925‚Üí        """Process a single fix with Claude tools"""
   926‚Üí        fix = fix_item.get("fix", {})
   927‚Üí        priority = fix_item.get("priority", 4)
   928‚Üí        category = fix_item.get("category", "unknown")
   929‚Üí        
   930‚Üí        print(f"üéØ Priority {priority} | {category.upper()} | {fix.get('type', 'unknown')}")
   931‚Üí        print(f"üìù {fix.get('description', 'No description')}")
   932‚Üí        
   933‚Üí        # Generate Claude prompt
   934‚Üí        claude_prompt = self.generate_claude_fix_prompt(fix_item)
   935‚Üí        
   936‚Üí        # Identify target file
   937‚Üí        target_file = self.extract_target_file(fix)
   938‚Üí        if not target_file:
   939‚Üí            print("‚ùå Could not identify target file for fix")
   940‚Üí            return {
   941‚Üí                "fix_item": fix_item,
   942‚Üí                "status": "failed",

   947‚Üí        print(f"üìÅ Target file: {target_file}")
   948‚Üí

   951‚Üí            print(f"\nüìã CLAUDE PROMPT:")
   952‚Üí            print("-" * 40)
   953‚Üí            print(claude_prompt)
   954‚Üí            print("-" * 40)
   955‚Üí            
   956‚Üí            response = input("\n‚ùì Apply this fix? (y/n/s=skip): ").lower()
   957‚Üí            if response == 'n':
   958‚Üí                print("‚ùå Fix cancelled by user")
   959‚Üí                return {
   960‚Üí                    "fix_item": fix_item,
   961‚Üí                    "status": "cancelled",

   963‚Üí                    "timestamp": datetime.now().isoformat()
   964‚Üí                }
   965‚Üí            elif response == 's':

   967‚Üí                return {
   968‚Üí                    "fix_item": fix_item,
   969‚Üí                    "status": "skipped", 
   970‚Üí                    "reason": "user_skipped",
   971‚Üí                    "timestamp": datetime.now().isoformat()
   972‚Üí                }
   973‚Üí        
   974‚Üí        # Create backup
   975‚Üí        backup_path = self.create_backup(target_file)
   976‚Üí        
   977‚Üí        # FORCE Claude to apply the fix - NO SIMULATION
   978‚Üí        print("\nü§ñ CLAUDE: YOU MUST APPLY THIS FIX NOW")
   979‚Üí        print("üëÜ USE THE PROMPT ABOVE TO MAKE THE EXACT FIX REQUIRED")
   980‚Üí        print("üî• THIS IS NOT A SIMULATION - APPLY THE ACTUAL FIX")
   981‚Üí        
   982‚Üí        # ENFORCE Claude action with specific validation
   983‚Üí        if not interactive:
   984‚Üí            print("\n‚ö†Ô∏è  AUTO-MODE: Claude MUST apply this fix before validation")
   985‚Üí            print("üö® SYSTEM WILL VALIDATE THE ACTUAL FILE CHANGE")
   986‚Üí        
   987‚Üí        # Wait for Claude to actually apply the fix
   988‚Üí        if interactive:
   989‚Üí            input("\n‚è∏Ô∏è  Press Enter ONLY after Claude has applied the actual fix...")
   990‚Üí        else:
   991‚Üí            # In auto-mode or claude-agent mode, provide clear instructions
   992‚Üí            print("\nü§ñ CLAUDE AGENT INSTRUCTION:")

   994‚Üí            print("YOU MUST NOW APPLY THIS FIX USING YOUR TOOLS:")

   998‚Üí            print("=" * 50)
   999‚Üí            print("\n‚è∏Ô∏è  Waiting 10 seconds for Claude to apply the fix...")
  1000‚Üí            time.sleep(10)
  1001‚Üí        
  1002‚Üí        # ENFORCE validation that Claude actually made the change
  1003‚Üí        validation_result = self.validate_fix_applied(fix_item, target_file)
  1004‚Üí        
  1005‚Üí        # Check if file was actually modified
  1006‚Üí        file_was_modified = self.verify_file_modification(target_file, backup_path)

  1009‚Üí        line_validation = self.validate_line_level_changes(fix_item, target_file, backup_path)
  1010‚Üí        
  1011‚Üí        if not validation_result["syntax_valid"]:

  1013‚Üí            
  1014‚Üí            # Use differential restoration instead of full rollback
  1015‚Üí            target_lines = self.extract_target_lines(fix_item)
  1016‚Üí            restoration_result = self.analyze_diff_and_restore_deleted(target_file, backup_path, target_lines)
  1017‚Üí            
  1018‚Üí            return {
  1019‚Üí                "fix_item": fix_item,
  1020‚Üí                "status": "failed",
  1021‚Üí                "reason": "syntax_validation_failed",
  1022‚Üí                "validation": validation_result,
  1023‚Üí                "line_validation": line_validation,
  1024‚Üí                "restoration": restoration_result,
  1025‚Üí                "backup_path": backup_path,

  1027‚Üí            }
  1028‚Üí        
  1029‚Üí        if not file_was_modified:
  1030‚Üí            print("‚ùå CLAUDE DID NOT APPLY THE FIX - FILE UNCHANGED")
  1031‚Üí            print("üö® ENFORCEMENT: Fix was not applied")
  1032‚Üí            return {
  1033‚Üí                "fix_item": fix_item,
  1034‚Üí                "status": "failed",
  1035‚Üí                "reason": "claude_did_not_apply_fix",
  1036‚Üí                "validation": validation_result,
  1037‚Üí                "line_validation": line_validation,
  1038‚Üí                "backup_path": backup_path,
  1039‚Üí                "timestamp": datetime.now().isoformat()
  1040‚Üí            }
  1041‚Üí        
  1042‚Üí        if not line_validation["valid_changes"]:
  1043‚Üí            print("‚ùå UNAUTHORIZED LINE CHANGES DETECTED")
  1044‚Üí            print("üö® ENFORCEMENT: Claude modified lines not mentioned in issue")
  1045‚Üí            
  1046‚Üí            # Use differential restoration to fix unauthorized changes
  1047‚Üí            target_lines = self.extract_target_lines(fix_item)
  1048‚Üí            restoration_result = self.analyze_diff_and_restore_deleted(target_file, backup_path, target_lines)
  1049‚Üí            
  1050‚Üí            return {
  1051‚Üí                "fix_item": fix_item,
  1052‚Üí                "status": "failed",
  1053‚Üí                "reason": "unauthorized_line_changes",
  1054‚Üí                "validation": validation_result,
  1055‚Üí                "line_validation": line_validation,
  1056‚Üí                "restoration": restoration_result,
  1057‚Üí                "backup_path": backup_path,
  1058‚Üí                "timestamp": datetime.now().isoformat()
  1059‚Üí            }
  1060‚Üí        
  1061‚Üí        print("‚úÖ Fix validated successfully - Claude applied authorized changes")
  1062‚Üí        
  1063‚Üí        # Clean up backup if fix was successful and no violations found
  1064‚Üí        backup_cleaned = self.cleanup_backup_if_successful(backup_path, line_validation)
  1065‚Üí        
  1066‚Üí        return {
  1067‚Üí            "fix_item": fix_item,
  1068‚Üí            "status": "applied",
  1069‚Üí            "validation": validation_result,
  1070‚Üí            "line_validation": line_validation,
  1071‚Üí            "backup_path": backup_path,
  1072‚Üí            "backup_cleaned": backup_cleaned,
  1073‚Üí            "timestamp": datetime.now().isoformat()
  1074‚Üí        }

  1076‚Üí    def extract_target_file(self, fix: Dict[str, Any]) -> Optional[str]:
  1077‚Üí        """Extract target file path from fix information"""
  1078‚Üí        # Try different ways to get file path
  1079‚Üí        file_path = fix.get("file")
  1080‚Üí        if file_path:
  1081‚Üí            return file_path
  1082‚Üí        
  1083‚Üí        # Extract from description
  1084‚Üí        description = fix.get("description", "")
  1085‚Üí        claude_prompt = fix.get("claude_prompt", "")
  1086‚Üí        
  1087‚Üí        # Look for file paths in text
  1088‚Üí        text = f"{description} {claude_prompt}"
  1089‚Üí        
  1090‚Üí        # Match patterns like "file.py:123" or "in /path/file.py"
  1091‚Üí        file_patterns = [
  1092‚Üí            r'([a-zA-Z0-9_/-]+\.py):\d+',
  1093‚Üí            r'in ([a-zA-Z0-9_/-]+\.py)',
  1094‚Üí            r'([a-zA-Z0-9_/-]+\.py)',
  1095‚Üí        ]
  1096‚Üí        
  1097‚Üí        for pattern in file_patterns:
  1098‚Üí            matches = re.findall(pattern, text)
  1099‚Üí            if matches:
  1100‚Üí                file_path = matches[0]
  1101‚Üí                # Make absolute path
  1102‚Üí                if not file_path.startswith('/'):
  1103‚Üí                    if file_path.startswith('src/'):
  1104‚Üí                        file_path = str(self.repo_path / file_path)
  1105‚Üí                    elif file_path.startswith('scripts/'):
  1106‚Üí                        file_path = str(self.repo_path / file_path)
  1107‚Üí                    else:
  1108‚Üí                        # Try to find the file
  1109‚Üí                        for candidate in self.repo_path.rglob(Path(file_path).name):
  1110‚Üí                            if candidate.is_file():
  1111‚Üí                                file_path = str(candidate)
  1112‚Üí                                break
  1113‚Üí                
  1114‚Üí                if Path(file_path).exists():
  1115‚Üí                    return file_path
  1116‚Üí        
  1117‚Üí        return None
  1118‚Üí    
  1119‚Üí    def generate_session_report(self, session_results: Dict[str, Any]) -> str:
  1120‚Üí        """Generate comprehensive session report"""
  1121‚Üí        report_lines = [
  1122‚Üí            "ü§ñ CLAUDE QUALITY PATCHER - SESSION REPORT",
  1123‚Üí            "=" * 60,
  1124‚Üí            f"üìÖ Session Start: {session_results.get('session_start', 'Unknown')}",
  1125‚Üí            f"üìÖ Session End: {session_results.get('session_end', 'Unknown')}",
  1126‚Üí            "",
  1127‚Üí            "üìä SUMMARY:",
  1128‚Üí            f"  ‚úÖ Fixes Applied: {session_results.get('fixes_applied', 0)}",
  1129‚Üí            f"  ‚è≠Ô∏è Fixes Skipped: {session_results.get('fixes_skipped', 0)}",
  1130‚Üí            f"  ‚ùå Fixes Failed: {session_results.get('fixes_failed', 0)}",
  1131‚Üí            f"  üìã Total Available: {session_results.get('total_available', 0)}",
  1132‚Üí            "",
  1133‚Üí            "üîß DETAILED RESULTS:",
  1134‚Üí        ]
  1135‚Üí        
  1136‚Üí        for i, fix_result in enumerate(session_results.get("fixes_processed", []), 1):
  1137‚Üí            status = fix_result.get("status", "unknown")
  1138‚Üí            fix_item = fix_result.get("fix_item", {})
  1139‚Üí            fix = fix_item.get("fix", {})
  1140‚Üí            
  1141‚Üí            status_emoji = "‚úÖ" if status == "applied" else "‚è≠Ô∏è" if status == "skipped" else "‚ùå"
  1142‚Üí            
  1143‚Üí            report_lines.extend([
  1144‚Üí                f"",
  1145‚Üí                f"{i}. {status_emoji} {status.upper()}",
  1146‚Üí                f"   Category: {fix_item.get('category', 'unknown')}",
  1147‚Üí                f"   Type: {fix.get('type', 'unknown')}",
  1148‚Üí                f"   Description: {fix.get('description', 'No description')[:80]}...",
  1149‚Üí            ])
  1150‚Üí            
  1151‚Üí            if status == "failed":
  1152‚Üí                reason = fix_result.get("reason", "unknown")
  1153‚Üí                report_lines.append(f"   Reason: {reason}")
  1154‚Üí        
  1155‚Üí        report_lines.extend([
  1156‚Üí            "",
  1157‚Üí            "üí° NEXT STEPS:",
  1158‚Üí            "1. Review failed fixes manually",
  1159‚Üí            "2. Re-run linting to see remaining issues",
  1160‚Üí            "3. Continue with next batch of fixes",
  1161‚Üí            "",
  1162‚Üí            "üîÑ To continue fixing:",
  1163‚Üí            "python3 scripts/claude_quality_patcher.py --continue --max-fixes 10"
  1164‚Üí        ])
  1165‚Üí        
  1166‚Üí        return "\\n".join(report_lines)
  1167‚Üí    
  1168‚Üí    def save_session_log(self):
  1169‚Üí        """Save session log for tracking"""
  1170‚Üí        log_dir = self.repo_path / ".claude_patches" / "logs"
  1171‚Üí        log_dir.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)
  1172‚Üí        
  1173‚Üí        timestamp = datetime.now().strftime("%Y%m%d_%H%M%S")
  1174‚Üí        log_file = log_dir / f"claude_patch_session_{timestamp}.json"
  1175‚Üí        
  1176‚Üí        session_data = {
  1177‚Üí            "session_info": {
  1178‚Üí                "timestamp": timestamp,
  1179‚Üí                "repo_path": str(self.repo_path),
  1180‚Üí                "lint_report": str(self.lint_report_path),
  1181‚Üí                "fixes_applied": self.fixes_applied,
  1182‚Üí                "fixes_skipped": self.fixes_skipped,
  1183‚Üí                "fixes_failed": self.fixes_failed
  1184‚Üí            },
  1185‚Üí            "session_log": self.session_log
  1186‚Üí        }
  1187‚Üí        
  1188‚Üí        with open(log_file, 'w') as f:
  1189‚Üí            json.dump(session_data, f, indent=2)
  1190‚Üí        
  1191‚Üí        print(f"üìä Session log saved: {log_file}")
  1192‚Üí        return log_file
  1193‚Üí
  1194‚Üí@click.command()
  1195‚Üí@click.option('--lint-report', type=click.Path(exists=True), help='Path to Claude lint report JSON file (auto-discovers if not provided)')
  1196‚Üí@click.option('--max-fixes', default=9999, help='Maximum number of fixes to apply in this session (default: ALL)')
  1197‚Üí@click.option('--interactive/--no-interactive', default=True, help='Interactive mode for fix confirmation')
  1198‚Üí@click.option('--auto-mode', is_flag=True, help='Run automatically with safe fixes only')
  1199‚Üí@click.option('--claude-agent', is_flag=True, help='Claude agent mode - outputs instructions for Claude to apply fixes')
  1200‚Üí@click.option('--dry-run', is_flag=True, help='Show what would be fixed without applying changes')
  1201‚Üí@click.option('--fresh-report', is_flag=True, help='Force generation of fresh lint report before fixing')
  1202‚Üí@click.option('--version-match', is_flag=True, help='Ensure lint report matches current codebase version (default: True)', default=True)
  1203‚Üídef main(lint_report, max_fixes, interactive, auto_mode, claude_agent, dry_run, fresh_report, version_match):
  1204‚Üí    """Claude Quality Patcher - Step-by-step fixing with Claude tools"""
  1205‚Üí    
  1206‚Üí    print("ü§ñ Claude Quality Patcher v1.0")
  1207‚Üí    print("=" * 60)
  1208‚Üí    
  1209‚Üí    # Initialize patcher with auto-discovery
  1210‚Üí    patcher = ClaudeQualityPatcher(
  1211‚Üí        repo_path=Path.cwd(),
  1212‚Üí        lint_report_path=Path(lint_report) if lint_report else None
  1213‚Üí    )
  1214‚Üí    
  1215‚Üí    # Handle fresh report generation
  1216‚Üí    if fresh_report or not patcher.lint_report_path:
  1217‚Üí        print("üîÑ Generating fresh lint report...")
  1218‚Üí        integration_success = patcher.auto_integrate_with_version_keeper()
  1219‚Üí        
  1220‚Üí        if not integration_success and not patcher.lint_report_path:
  1221‚Üí            print("‚ùå Failed to generate or find lint report")
  1222‚Üí            print("üí° Try running manually:")
  1223‚Üí            print("   python3 scripts/version_keeper.py --comprehensive-lint --output-dir=reports/")
  1224‚Üí            sys.exit(1)
  1225‚Üí    
  1226‚Üí    # Validate we have a working report
  1227‚Üí    if not patcher.lint_report:
  1228‚Üí        print("‚ùå No valid lint report loaded")
  1229‚Üí        sys.exit(1)
  1230‚Üí    
  1231‚Üí    # Start session
  1232‚Üí    session_info = patcher.start_claude_session()
  1233‚Üí    
  1234‚Üí    if dry_run:
  1235‚Üí        print("üîç DRY RUN MODE - Analyzing fixes without applying...")
  1236‚Üí        priority_fixes = patcher.get_priority_fixes()
  1237‚Üí        
  1238‚Üí        print(f"\\nüìã FIXES TO BE APPLIED:")
  1239‚Üí        for i, fix_item in enumerate(priority_fixes[:max_fixes], 1):
  1240‚Üí            fix = fix_item.get("fix", {})
  1241‚Üí            priority = fix_item.get("priority", 4)
  1242‚Üí            category = fix_item.get("category", "unknown")
  1243‚Üí            
  1244‚Üí            priority_emoji = "üî¥" if priority == 1 else "üü°" if priority == 2 else "üü¢"
  1245‚Üí            
  1246‚Üí            print(f"{i}. {priority_emoji} [{category.upper()}] {fix.get('description', 'No description')}")
  1247‚Üí        
  1248‚Üí        print(f"\\n‚úÖ Dry run complete. {len(priority_fixes[:max_fixes])} fixes ready to apply.")
  1249‚Üí        return
  1250‚Üí    
  1251‚Üí    # Auto mode configuration
  1252‚Üí    if auto_mode:
  1253‚Üí        interactive = False
  1254‚Üí        print("üîÑ AUTO MODE: Applying safe fixes automatically...")
  1255‚Üí    
  1256‚Üí    # Claude agent mode configuration
  1257‚Üí    if claude_agent:
  1258‚Üí        interactive = False
  1259‚Üí        print("ü§ñ CLAUDE AGENT MODE: Outputting instructions for Claude to apply fixes...")
  1260‚Üí        print("=" * 60)
  1261‚Üí        print("üéØ CLAUDE: This mode will show you exactly what to fix.")
  1262‚Üí        print("   Use your Write/Edit tools to apply each fix as instructed.")
  1263‚Üí        print("=" * 60 + "\n")
  1264‚Üí    
  1265‚Üí    # Run step-by-step fixes
  1266‚Üí    session_results = patcher.run_step_by_step_fixes(
  1267‚Üí        max_fixes=max_fixes,
  1268‚Üí        interactive=interactive
  1269‚Üí    )
  1270‚Üí    
  1271‚Üí    # Generate and show report
  1272‚Üí    report = patcher.generate_session_report(session_results)
  1273‚Üí    print("\\n" + report)
  1274‚Üí    
  1275‚Üí    # Save session log
  1276‚Üí    patcher.save_session_log()
  1277‚Üí    
  1278‚Üí    print("\\nüéâ Claude Quality Patcher session complete!")
  1279‚Üí
  1280‚Üíif __name__ == "__main__":
  1281‚Üí    main()
